Title: Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
About Prestatech




At Prestatech, we're redefining the financial world by fostering innovation and challenging the traditional banking system. Our culture is diverse, dynamic, and forward-thinking. From our offices in Berlin and Milan, we create cutting-edge API technologies in an inclusive environment where everyone can contribute their best work.




Founded in 2021 by Christian Nothacker, Luca Terragni, and Lorenzo Giusti, Prestatech combines document automation and proprietary technology to help financial institutions and B2B companies make quick, reliable, and inclusive credit decisions for SMEs and consumers.




When most people think of getting a loan or mortgage, they picture a slow and tedious process. Our mission is to simplify that through technology.




We’re a young and fast-growing company—but this is our second venture. Before Prestatech, we founded and exited Prestacap, a lending platform for SMEs active in Italy and Germany.




We’re passionate about data and technology, never satisfied with the status quo, and believe that teamwork is key to achieving ambitious goals together.




To date, we have raised €8 million, which is helping us bring more innovative solutions to market, expand operations in Italy, and launch in the UK, Germany, and the US..




We’re now looking for a Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d), someone with prior experience in fintech who is hands-on, outcome-driven, and deeply curious about solving business problems with data and AI.


Tasks


You would be joining a flexible and dynamic team and your role will include:





selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques


processing, cleansing and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis


deep dive on the problems using SQL and scripting languages to drive solutions leveraging Statistical Analysis


implement and scale data pipelines and solutions using Big Data technologies


design, train, and deploy machine learning models and AI-based solutions for credit scoring, fraud detection, and other core financial applications.


collaborate closely with the development team to recommend and build innovations based on Data Science


own the process: identify and execute on high impact projects, triage external requests, and make sure you bring projects to conclusion in time for the results to be useful


leverage AI tools to achieve even better and faster results



Requirements



6+ years of experience in Data Science, ideally in fintech or financial services


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or related field (MSc/PhD preferred)


Strong understanding of Big Data frameworks and cloud platforms.


Expertise in machine learning and AI techniques


Proficient in Python, with hands-on experience using Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn


Skilled in working with SQL/NoSQL databases


Experience with version control (Git) and writing clean, maintainable code


Experience with financial datasets, credit scoring, or risk modeling is a strong plus





Not sure you meet evert single requirement? Don’t worry — if this role excites you and you believe you could be a good fit, we’d still love to hear from you. At Prestatech, we value potential, curiosity, and passion just as much as experience.


Benefits



Excellent compensation aligned with your experience and impact


A career path that allows you to take yourself to the next level


Annual training budget to help you grow and develop


2 days per week of Smart Working (+ 3 days at the office)


Flexible working arrangements, with the understanding that building a successful startup sometimes requires periods of focused, intense work


Bi-annual company offsites


Referral bonus


a co-working office in one of the best district of Milan (Isola)





Recruitment Process:





HR Interview (30 minutes)


Assessment Test (up to 60 minutes)


CEO/CTO Interview (30 minutes)





If you have any specific requirements or need accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know — we’re happy to support you.




At Prestatech, we actively embrace diversity and are committed to fostering a safe, inclusive, and welcoming workplace for everyone. Our recruitment process is free from discrimination of any kind — including on the basis of race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity, or sexual orientation.




With over 25 employees from more than 15 different countries, our diversity drives innovation, enriches our culture, and challenges us to consider multiple perspectives every day.

Show more
HTML:
About Prestatech


At Prestatech, we're redefining the financial world by fostering innovation and challenging the traditional banking system. Our culture is diverse, dynamic, and forward-thinking. From our offices in Berlin and Milan, we create cutting-edge API technologies in an inclusive environment where everyone can contribute their best work.


Founded in 2021 by Christian Nothacker, Luca Terragni, and Lorenzo Giusti, Prestatech combines document automation and proprietary technology to help financial institutions and B2B companies make quick, reliable, and inclusive credit decisions for SMEs and consumers.


When most people think of getting a loan or mortgage, they picture a slow and tedious process. Our mission is to simplify that through technology.


We’re a young and fast-growing company—but this is our second venture. Before Prestatech, we founded and exited Prestacap, a lending platform for SMEs active in Italy and Germany.


We’re passionate about data and technology, never satisfied with the status quo, and believe that teamwork is key to achieving ambitious goals together.


To date, we have raised €8 million, which is helping us bring more innovative solutions to market, expand operations in Italy, and launch in the UK, Germany, and the US..


We’re now looking for a Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d), someone with prior experience in fintech who is hands-on, outcome-driven, and deeply curious about solving business problems with data and AI.


Tasks

You would be joining a flexible and dynamic team and your role will include:



  • selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques

  • processing, cleansing and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis

  • deep dive on the problems using SQL and scripting languages to drive solutions leveraging Statistical Analysis

  • implement and scale data pipelines and solutions using Big Data technologies

  • design, train, and deploy machine learning models and AI-based solutions for credit scoring, fraud detection, and other core financial applications.

  • collaborate closely with the development team to recommend and build innovations based on Data Science

  • own the process: identify and execute on high impact projects, triage external requests, and make sure you bring projects to conclusion in time for the results to be useful

  • leverage AI tools to achieve even better and faster results


Requirements

  • 6+ years of experience in Data Science, ideally in fintech or financial services

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or related field (MSc/PhD preferred)

  • Strong understanding of Big Data frameworks and cloud platforms.

  • Expertise in machine learning and AI techniques

  • Proficient in Python, with hands-on experience using Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn

  • Skilled in working with SQL/NoSQL databases

  • Experience with version control (Git) and writing clean, maintainable code

  • Experience with financial datasets, credit scoring, or risk modeling is a strong plus


Not sure you meet evert single requirement? Don’t worry — if this role excites you and you believe you could be a good fit, we’d still love to hear from you. At Prestatech, we value potential, curiosity, and passion just as much as experience.


Benefits

  • Excellent compensation aligned with your experience and impact

  • A career path that allows you to take yourself to the next level

  • Annual training budget to help you grow and develop

  • 2 days per week of Smart Working (+ 3 days at the office)

  • Flexible working arrangements, with the understanding that building a successful startup sometimes requires periods of focused, intense work

  • Bi-annual company offsites

  • Referral bonus

  • a co-working office in one of the best district of Milan (Isola)


Recruitment Process:



  • HR Interview (30 minutes)

  • Assessment Test (up to 60 minutes)

  • CEO/CTO Interview (30 minutes)


If you have any specific requirements or need accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know — we’re happy to support you.


At Prestatech, we actively embrace diversity and are committed to fostering a safe, inclusive, and welcoming workplace for everyone. Our recruitment process is free from discrimination of any kind — including on the basis of race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity, or sexual orientation.


With over 25 employees from more than 15 different countries, our diversity drives innovation, enriches our culture, and challenges us to consider multiple perspectives every day.

Title: JR Research & Development- parte analisi | Settore Farmaceutico | Cologno
HTML:
Jobtech, agenzia digitale per il lavoro, è alla ricerca di due risorse da inserirenel dipartiment di R&D - parte Analisi per un'importante realtà che opera nel settore chimico-farmaceutico, situata a Cologno Monzese (MI).


Cosa prevede l'offerta?


  • Tipologia di inserimento: RAL da commisurare in base ad esperienza pregressa nel ruolo + Ticket elettronici pari a 8€ + Premio di produzione annuale di cui massimo importo 2.000€. + Premio welfare annuale : 200€.
  • Giorni e orari di lavoro: Lavoro a giornata lun- venerdi (39 ore settimanali) entrata flessibile 7.45- 09.30 pausa pranzo da 45 min fino a 1.5h, il venerdì 7 ore.
  • Periodo di inizio: settembre 2025. Avrai l’opportunità di entrare a far parte di un'azienda leader nel settore chimico-farmaceutico, dinamica e impegnata nell'innovazione continua.


Cosa vorremmo trovare in te?


  • Laurea in discipline scientifiche (Chimica, CTF, Farmacia, Biotecnologie Farmaceutiche);
  • Esperienza di almeno 1 anno in ruoli analoghi;
  • Buone capacità organizzative;
  • Eccellenti doti di lavoro in team;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (scritta e parlata), livello B2;
  • Automunito/a.


Di cosa ti occuperai?


  • Collabora nello sviluppo, messa a punto e convalida dei metodi analitici;
  • Collabora nell’effettuare analisi e identificazioni di sostanze incognite;
  • Collabora nell’effettuare valutazioni di carryover di impurezze e di degradazioni forzate;
  • Svolge ogni attività di supporto analitico volta all’acquisizione di nuove conoscenze e alla risoluzione di problematiche;
  • Collabora nell’effettuare controlli di processo e troubleshooting;
  • Effettua la stesura di report analitici con la supervisione dell’R&D Analytical Senior e dell’R&D Analytical Supervisor;
  • Rispetta le normative GMP (ove richiesto) e quanto stabilito in termini di vestizione e sicurezza nell’ambito delle proprie attività.
  • Esegue la calibrazione interna degli strumenti analitici


Se pensi che questa possa essere l’opportunità giusta per te, candidati subito.


Jobtech è un'Agenzia per il lavoro improntata alle pari opportunità: diversità e inclusione sono al primo posto per noi! Ogni candidatura, per ogni posizione aperta, sarà accolta e considerata sulla base degli effettivi meriti e competenze, nel rispetto delle specificità di ciascun ruolo a prescindere da pelle, razza, nazionalità, etnia, sesso, genere, orientamento sessuale, stato coniugale, disabilità, responsabilità genitoriali, età, religione o credo.


Jobtech è iscritta all'Albo Informatico delle Agenzie per il Lavoro Sez. I n.95 del 15 luglio 2020.

Autorizzazione ANPAL n°44 del 26/04/2022.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




Are you curious and ready to accept a new challenge in your career? Are you eager to join a dynamic company and bring innovation through your work and skills?




Prometeia offers you opportunities for growth and training in a Group with over 1000 professionals working for more than 500 clients in 20 countries around the world.




RESPONSIBILITIES:




● Analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data in banking and insurance, identifying useful patterns and insights to support business processes and decisions.

● Design, develop and implement advanced machine learning, data mining and statistical models to solve complex problems in finance.

● Collaborate in cross-functional teams to define project requirements and propose innovative solutions.

● Contribute to the development of proprietary frameworks and algorithms to improve the performance of solutions offered to our clients.

● Present complex results to technical and non-technical stakeholders, making analysis results understandable.

● Support customers in implementing solutions, ensuring knowledge transfer and customization.




REQUIREMENTS:




● Experience in data wrangling, cleaning, exploration and feature extraction.

● Excellent knowledge of Python and the most important analytical libraries.

● Knowledge of statistics, Machine Learning and major clustering, classification and regression algorithms

● Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques, predictive modeling with the application of Machine Learning models, and data analysis.

● Ability to creatively solve complex problems and propose innovative solutions.

● Ability to rapidly prototype ideas/solutions with a critical/experimental approach to data analysis.

● Good communication skills and ability to translate technical results into insights for non-experts.

● Aptitude for teamwork, with strong orientation toward interdisciplinary collaboration.

● At least one year of working experience in applied ML projects.




EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

● Master's degree or PhD with excellent grades in Data Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related fields




NICE TO HAVE:

● Experience with code versioning systems (git).

● Experience in Pyspark development and working in big data platforms.

● Knowledge of at least one major cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS).

● Experience in processing and modeling with unstructured data (Text Analytics, Computer Vision)




SOFT SKILLS:

A problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset.
Exceptional communication skills and meticulous attention to detail.
A team player with excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Passionate about process innovation and driven by curiosity to understand and optimize business processes.







LOCATION:

Milan




WHAT WE OFFER:

COMPENSATION, WELFARE & BENEFIT

Our history, as well as the future, is based on the value of our people. The biggest investment at Prometeia is in our people, and it concerns every aspect of professional life. We call it 'Total Compensation' and is made up of Compensation - consisting of a fixed and a variable component -, an important Welfare Plan, active since 2015 – we have been among the first to introduce it in Italy - and Benefits, which include all the initiatives undertaken for the well-being of our people.




REMOTE WORKING

Flexibility is an intrinsic value of the way we work. At Prometeia, smart working is an organizational method based on trust, which results in benefits in terms of work/life balance, impact on the environment and optimization of company results, through autonomy and empowerment of people.




PEOPLE PROGRAM

Our evaluation system is based on the full enhancement of people and their continuous dialogue as a stimulus for regular, mutual professional and personal growth. Transparent discussions between managers and team members are set up within the projects, where reciprocal and timely feedback is exchanged. The process is fully digitalized and aimed at continuously improving the development trajectory of the individual and the company.




TRAINING

Prometeia means ongoing training. We provide an average of 11 days of training per year to our people, in person and online. Particular attention is paid to younger colleagues, who are the protagonists of dedicated growth programs, and to the continuous sharing and internal transfer of know-how and skills. On-the-job training is also important, through immediate and direct confrontation with the market.




WIN/WIN POLICY

If you are one of our employees, and you recommend a person who is later recruited, you are entitled to a financial bonus! This is an important opportunity to contribute to the growth of Prometeia as a whole, by attracting acknowledged market professionals and new tech talents.




PHYGITAL MANAGEMENT

Through the dedicated app Pr(Home)teia, we have completely digitalized and integrated the management of our physical and virtual environments. Access to the office, smart working, workstations, meeting rooms, car pooling... everything is just a click away.




COMMUNITY

Our Community is extremely diverse, as are the skills of the people who are part of it and who share its values, and the individuals and organizations that are directly or indirectly involved in our activities. Clients, People of the Group, Alumni, Institutions, Academia, non-profit entities with which we actively collaborate, are stakeholders representing a great value for us, in terms of trust and collaboration.




DIVERSITY

We promote and respect equal opportunities and consider differences as a value. Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental values: from the selection phase to everyday life, also through dedicated training moments to develop individual sensitivities and unicities.




IMPACT

We responsibly take an active role towards the environment, the territories and the communities in which we operate. Our Headquarter in Bologna has obtained the Leed Gold Certification, one of the highest awards that recognizes the performance of the building in terms of energy and water savings, reduction of CO2 emissions, improvement of the ecological quality of the interior, materials and resources used. In the Sustainability Report we report the results achieved within the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda that, drafted by the United Nations in 2016, we have been supporting since 2020.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
MEET FIDES




Fides è una tech company che da vent’anni si contraddistingue sul mercato per una doppia offerta di servizio: partnership consulenziali con i più importanti system integrator internazionali e sviluppo di progetti IT custom.




Grazie a 20 anni di esperienza e oltre 300 risorse dislocate tra le sedi (Milano, Napoli, Roma e Torino), Fides si posiziona tra le principali aziende italiane Hi-tech.




Le competenze e i progetti Fides si estendono dal Banking & Finance, al Digital Retail, alle tecnologie per il Monitoraggio Ambientale, ai Servizi e Soluzioni ICT per l’Industry 4.0, per l’e-commerce e la logistica.




JOB OPPORTUNITY




Per un progetto ad alto contenuto tecnologico, stiamo cercando un AI Engineer con una solida esperienza in Python e Large Language Models (LLM), da inserire in un contesto di sviluppo e ottimizzazione di soluzioni avanzate di AI generativa.




In questo ruolo, contribuirai all’addestramento, fine tuning e integrazione di LLM, sia locali (per garantire data sovereignty, sicurezza e conformità normativa in contesti altamente regolamentati) sia non locali, in base alle esigenze specifiche dei progetti. Le soluzioni saranno sviluppate su misura per i clienti, attraverso pipeline intelligenti e scalabili, perfettamente in linea con le evoluzioni più recenti dell’Intelligenza Artificiale.




TECHNICAL SKILLS




Buona conoscenza del linguaggio Python
Esperienza nell’utilizzo di LLM e AI generativa
Conoscenza (anche teorica) di tecniche di fine tuning di modelli
Familiarità con strumenti e framework come PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face Transformers
Utilizzo di strumenti per l’ottimizzazione e l’addestramento dei modelli (unsloth, deepspeed, LoRA, QLoRA, ecc.)
Conoscenze in ambito AI non generativa (costituisce un plus)
Interesse per le tecnologie emergenti e capacità di problem solving
Gradita esperienza con piattaforme cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Conoscenze generali di Java e familiarità con lo sviluppo di backend tramite framework quali Spring/Spring Boot (nice to have)
Esperienza (anche base) nella progettazione di soluzioni cloud-native e architetture distribuite (nice to have)




HUMAN SKILLS




Ottime doti comunicative e di problem solving
Predisposizione al lavoro in team
Conoscenza della lingua inglese
Proattività e orientamento al risultato




WHY FIDES




Hybrid work
Buoni pasto e welfare contrattuale
Assicurazione sanitaria aggiuntiva
Feedback continuo orientato alla crescita
Ambiente di lavoro giovane e innovativo




HUMAN-CENTRIC COMPANY




Il nostro asset più importante sono le persone e lavoriamo ogni giorno per migliorare il work-life balance delle nostre risorse. Fiducia, feedback e collaborazione sono valori strettamente connessi alla nostra idea di leadership e che rientrano nelle relazioni con le nostre persone e i nostri clienti e partner.




Livello e inquadramento saranno commisurati all'effettiva esperienza maturata.




Crediamo nei valori della diversità e dell’inclusione di genere e cultura prestando inoltre attenzione e sensibilità ai/alle candidati/e appartenenti alle categorie protette, ai sensi degli articoli 1 e 18 della legge 68 del ‘99.I dati personali saranno trattati in conformità alle disposizioni contenute nel regolamento UE 2016/679.

Show more

Title: Junior – Monitor Deloitte
Description:
Stiamo cercando figure junior da inserire nel team di Monitor Deloitte nella sede di Milano, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Your Role

Nel ruolo di Analyst, all’interno del team di lavoro la risorsa si occuperà di:


Strategic Transformation & Innovation: supporto nella definizione di strategie innovative e sostenibili di business transformation volte alla creazione di valore delle aziende clienti con l’obiettivo di ottimizzare il proprio portafoglio prodotti, adottando un approccio orientato alla differenziazione;
Customer Strategy: supporto nella definizione e realizzazione di strategie e processi di trasformazione dei modelli di marketing, customer management e pricing;
Digital Strategy: supporto nella definizione di strategie orientate alla digital transformation;
M&A Strategy: supporto nella gestione dell’intero processo di M&A, dalla definizione della strategia fino alla selezione del giusto partner passando per la conduzione di una commercial due diligence approfondita, fino alla chiusura del deal e alla relativa gestione del programma di integrazione.


Winning Requirements


Laurea Magistrale conseguita oppure a massimo 6 mesi dal suo conseguimento
Esperienza da 0 a 1 anni in società di consulenza strategica
Brillante percorso accademico in ambito: Economico, Ingegneristico, Informatico, Fisico, Matematico o Statistico
Esperienza pregressa in contesti internazionali
Ottimo livello di inglese


Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.
Show more
HTML:
Stiamo cercando figure junior da inserire nel team di Monitor Deloitte nella sede di Milano, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Your Role

Nel ruolo di Analyst, all’interno del team di lavoro la risorsa si occuperà di:

  • Strategic Transformation & Innovation: supporto nella definizione di strategie innovative e sostenibili di business transformation volte alla creazione di valore delle aziende clienti con l’obiettivo di ottimizzare il proprio portafoglio prodotti, adottando un approccio orientato alla differenziazione;
  • Customer Strategy: supporto nella definizione e realizzazione di strategie e processi di trasformazione dei modelli di marketing, customer management e pricing;
  • Digital Strategy: supporto nella definizione di strategie orientate alla digital transformation;
  • M&A Strategy: supporto nella gestione dell’intero processo di M&A, dalla definizione della strategia fino alla selezione del giusto partner passando per la conduzione di una commercial due diligence approfondita, fino alla chiusura del deal e alla relativa gestione del programma di integrazione.

Winning Requirements

  • Laurea Magistrale conseguita oppure a massimo 6 mesi dal suo conseguimento
  • Esperienza da 0 a 1 anni in società di consulenza strategica
  • Brillante percorso accademico in ambito: Economico, Ingegneristico, Informatico, Fisico, Matematico o Statistico
  • Esperienza pregressa in contesti internazionali
  • Ottimo livello di inglese

Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Researcher
Description:
Artificial Intelligence Researcher (LLM Fine-Tuning Specialist)




Solomei AI creates a new generation of websites, combining human creativity and advanced AI. Our platform leverages AI agents built on advanced AI technologies, enabling dynamic and effective content presentation. As we continue to grow, we're seeking talented individuals who are excited to innovate at the intersection of human creativity and artificial intelligence.




Complex Problems You’ll Be Leading

Design, build, and maintain high-quality datasets specifically tailored for fine-tuning transformer-based LLMs (LLaMA, Mistral).
Develop and manage sophisticated fine-tuning pipelines (LoRA, QLoRA, PEFT), ensuring performance, scalability, and deployment efficiency.
Solve optimization challenges in fine-tuning, including parameter-efficient techniques and distillation strategies.




In This Role, You Will

Lead and implement advanced fine-tuning and distillation techniques (e.g., LoRA, QLoRA, adapter modules) on transformer architectures.
Oversee dataset quality assurance processes explicitly for transformer fine-tuning tasks.
Create rigorous evaluation frameworks to benchmark model accuracy, efficiency, and robustness post-fine-tuning.
Collaborate directly with GPU cloud providers to optimize LLM training and inference.
Collaborate with product teams, translating product goals into technical fine-tuning requirements.




You Are a Great Fit If You Have

Master or PhD or in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related fields.
3+ years leading large-scale data initiatives, including pipeline architecture and quality assurance.
Proven expertise applying parameter-efficient fine-tuning techniques such as LoRA, QLoRA, PEFT, adapters, etc.
Advanced proficiency with PyTorch, Hugging Face, and cloud-based deployments.
Proven leadership and independent project management skills.

Show more

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Power digital products with AI. Work with product teams to identify high-impact opportunities where AI can transform the user experience for millions—and then build the solutions to make them happen. Drive the process from possibility to production, delivering code that’s robust, reproducible, and built for scale.
Explore ways to push the boundaries of our AI capabilities. Stay at the bleeding edge of AI by investigating new models, techniques, and research. Learn fast across new domains, share findings with the team, and turn breakthrough ideas into production systems that deliver real-world impact.
Refine data foundations for exceptional results. Own the full data lifecycle—from acquisition and labeling to loading and management—to ensure our models are trained on clean, high-quality datasets that power top-performing systems.
Own your impact, end-to-end. Set smart priorities, manage execution, and consistently deliver high-quality results, even in ambiguous or fast-changing environments. Balance technical depth with strong ownership, growing your skills while delivering meaningful contributions.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £66,779 in the UK and €63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £110,389 and £149,636 in the UK, and €105,737 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time or part-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They’re challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities—just let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you’ve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
TL;DR

We're building the next Netsuite/Odoo for the AI-age (an enterprise operations platform)
Founded by the team that scaled GitGuardian and talent.io
Backed by top-tier VCs (3M€ pre-seed)
Thrive in fast-paced AI-startup
Once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to join a tight-knit, world-class early team
Competitive salary plus equity ownership
Location: Remote (EU)




Why now?

Legacy ERPs can’t handle real-time decisions, AI-native workflows, or modern business speed.
SMEs need to move fast, but their outdated tools slow them down.
Agent frameworks are ready for real business use.




Why join us?

You'll help invent a new category of enterprise software with a small, elite team. The problems go far beyond CRUD: real-time orchestration, autonomous IA-agents, proactive interfaces. This is foundational work. Backed by €3M from top-tier VCs (Daphni, Ovni, Motier …) and top BA (Pennylane, Studapart..) we’re moving fast from zero to one.




What you’ll build

The goal of our AI-native application is to have AI interfaces for most features

You’ll take part in building:

Configuration agents to help users create their automation workflows, adapt the data model to their particular needs, enforce their processes
Data querying agents to extracts precise metrics and information
Data storage merging structured and unstructured data, to extract high level business insights.
Recommendation agents to make our software pro-active




What you bring

You should have experience in both backend web development and Machine learning, applying rigorous, data-driven research approaches to product feature building.

We want you to have the drive to build a new kind of software, less passive, more flexible; and help drive the agentic vision.

Backend expertise: Strong Python skills, databases, distributed systems, and async processing (Django/FastAPI a bonus).
Applied AI skills: Experience with the python machine learning ecosystem, NLP, agentic frameworks (we know it’s a recent field), complex RAG systems.
Ownership: You own features end to end, from design and development to deployment and user feedback. You’re comfortable talking to customers and iterating quickly.

Talent beats checklists. If you're intrigued, apply anyway.




How we work

Total ownership: End-to-end impact.
Zero bureaucracy: Small, agile team driving rapid execution.
Craft with velocity: We move fast by shipping small and never compromising on excellence.
Radical prioritization: One goal at a time, done right.
No egos: Feedback with recommendations can come from anyone, across any team.




What you get:

Competitive salary (€90k to €120k/year) + meaningful equity.
Exceptional peers and a cutting-edge AI stack.
Ideal equipment and setup (top-tier gear, remote-friendly).
Regular company offsites (2–4 times per year) in inspiring locations.
Location: We have offices in Paris and Biarritz. You can also work fully remote, France (preferred)




Who’s building Piston?

We’re a tight-knit founding team that’s scaled from zero to growth before at talent.io and GitGuardian in the last 7 years. We've shipped product, built teams, and grown revenue from scratch. We work across product, engineering, and GTM as one unit, writing code, talking to users, and making the hard calls together. We’ve lived the pain of ERP firsthand, and we’re building the product we wish we had. We bias for action, care deeply about craft, and know how to move fast without breaking trust.




Interview Process (max 2 weeks)

Intro call with Eric (CEO) – 40 min
Technical deep dive with Eugène (CTO) – 90 min
Culture fit conversation with Florian (CRO) – 30 min
Reference calls (2)
Paid 2-day assessment
Fast offer




This is the moment to shape what come next, not iterate on the past

Apply with a short note on why you're excited: founders@pistonhq.app

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We are currently looking for a “Data Scientist” to strengthen the Cronos Europa team.


This position requires a maximum of 5 days per month at client offices. However, teleworking must take place within 2 hours of Brussels.


Responsabilities:

  • Coordination and review of policy units’ business needs;
  • Definition of solutions proposed for servicing policy units’ business needs;
  • Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users, project leaders and the developers;
  • Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks;
  • Creating, designing and developing data models;
  • Analyse large datasets and propose approaches for optimisation of reporting;
  • Assessment and quality control of data;
  • Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders;
  • Management and processing of data;
  • Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available;
  • Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI;
  • Assistance with data management aspects of IT projects developed.


Technical skills:

  • Data Analytics techniques and tools.
  • Power BI (including Power Query).
  • Experience with one or more of the following: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, Languages like Visual Basic, SQL, Other business intelligence tools (SAP Business Objects, QlikSense, SAS…), ETL processes and tools (i.e. Azure Data Factory…).
  • SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL).
  • Architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores.
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas: predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, social media crawling and processing, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation systems.


Profile:

  • Bachelor's degree minimum
  • English fluent
  • Ability to integrate in multicultural environment, team player, discretion, integrity, problem solving.


Why Cronos Group?

We’ll propose you:

  • An attractive salary package
  • A good work-life balance environment
  • The assurance of working in cutting-edge technologies in an entrepreneurial spirit.
  • The opportunity to develop your skills thanks to tailor-made training courses according to your needs
  • A good job in a friendly place

If you wish to integrate a dynamic structure on a human scale while working with the latest technologies, don't wait anymore and join Cronos!

Title: Data Scientist – Transformez la mobilité de demain
Description:
Data Scientist – Transformez la mobilité de demain




Notre partenaire, une software company belge, recherche un Data Scientist dans le but de renforcer leur département IA.




Data Scientist – L’entreprise :




Notre partenaire est l’une des entreprises tech les plus innovantes de Belgique. Elle propose des solutions sur mesure à ses clients dans les domaines de la Sécurité, Mobilité, Environnement & L’analyse.




Sa technologie unique au monde lui a rapidement permis d’être leader sur le territoire belge et de se lancer à la conquête du territoire européen.




Cette entreprise à taille humaine vous permettra d’évoluer dans des équipes jeunes et dynamiques ou il fait bon vivre.




Data Scientist – Le rôle:




Premièrement, la structure aime avant tout les gens curieux, collaboratifs, désireux d'avoir un impact et qui valorisent l'innovation, l'autonomie et l'esprit d'équipe.




Deuxièmement, dans ce poste spécifique, il sera important pour vous d'avoir de l'expérience sur les points suivants : Python Data Processing & Visualisation libraries – ML & Deep Learning




L’objectif principal sera d’accélérer et d’améliorer la prise de décision des acteurs du monde de la mobilité via vos prédictions et des outils d’Intelligence Artificielle




Data Scientist – Le profil :




Vous disposez d’un Master Degree en Computer Science / Engineering
Vous avez 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer
Vous maitrisez Python et ses librairies de visualisations, Hadoop – Spark – Kafka sont un plus




Data Scientist – L’offre:




Salaire annuel allant jusque 85.000 € (en fonction de votre expérience)

Sa technologie unique au monde lui a rapidement permis d’être leader sur le territoire belge et de se lancer à la conquête du territoire européen.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Role: Machine Learning / AI Engineer – Fully remote in Europe




I'm urgently hiring for a Senior Machine Learning / AI Engineer on behalf of a leading media organisation. They’re expanding their platforms around content creation and require immediate support to manage increasing demand through Q3 & Q4 2025, and into 2026.




You will need experience in LLM’s and speech to text and sentiment analysis. The business are not using anything specific so experience working with a range of tools and selecting the right models is a large focus.




The business are around 500 employees across Europe and have been founded almost 10 years. This is almost a build out of there ML capabilities so somebody who can scale out ML processes would be great.

Contract: Initial 6+ months

Location: Fully remote (Europe-based candidates only)

Rate: €450 – €600/day

Start: ASAP




Key Requirements:

Proven expertise in Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence
Hands-on experience with Large Language Models (LLMs) & signal extraction / semantic analytics
Needs experience working on recommendation systems
Strong data extraction capabilities
Solid experience building production-ready systems and AWS infrastructure
Technical leadership or senior-level experience highly desirable

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities :


  • Coordination and review of policy units’ business needs;
  • Definition of solutions proposed for servicing policy units’ business needs;
  • Interaction with the business analysts, customer, users, project leaders and the developers;
  • Carry out ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks;
  • Creating, designing and developing data models;
  • Analyse large datasets and propose approaches for optimisation of reporting;
  • Assessment and quality control of data;
  • Preparation of statistical analysis of data for use by policy officers and other stakeholders;
  • Management and processing of data;
  • Reporting of key indicators for different policy fields on the basis of data sets available;
  • Development and maintenance of interactive dashboards in Power BI;


Qualifications


  • Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools.
  • Good knowledge of Power BI (including Power Query).
  • Experience with one or more of the following:
  • Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing.
  • Languages like Visual Basic, SQL, ….
  • Other business intelligence tools (SAP Business Objects, QlikSense, SAS…).
  • ETL processes and tools (i.e. Azure Data Factory…).
  • Knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL).
  • Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores.
  • Knowledge in one of the following areas:


o predictive (forecasting, recommendation),

o prescriptive (simulation),

o sentiment analysis,

o topic detection,

o social media crawling and processing,

o trends/anomalies detection in datasets,

o recommendation systems.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist – AI & Microsoft Services




Location: Brussels (Hybrid – 2 days onsite, 3 remote)

Start: ASAP | Type: Freelance




About the Role

We’re looking for a hands-on Data Scientist / AI Engineer to design and deliver impactful AI applications using Microsoft AI Services, Generative AI, and Copilot. You’ll take on diverse business challenges: from building virtual assistants to automating internal workflows, and turn them into production-ready solutions that enhance customer experiences, empower employees, and optimise processes.




This role is self-directed and innovation-focused. You’ll work with techniques such as Prompt Engineering, RAG, fine-tuning, speech-to-text, image generation & interpretation, and classical ML/statistical methods. You’ll collaborate closely with business stakeholders and technical teams, communicate results directly to leadership, and contribute to reusable AI frameworks in an Agile environment.




Key Responsibilities

Design and implement AI solutions using Microsoft AI ecosystem tools (Azure AI, Azure Machine Learning, Cognitive Services, Copilot)
Apply a mix of Generative AI and Predictive AI methods to real-world use cases
Build proof-of-concepts and evolve them into scalable, production-ready solutions in Python
Share insights with the team and help define AI best practices
Present results and recommendations to senior stakeholders




What You Bring

Strong Python and AI/ML development skills
Experience deploying AI applications into production
Knowledge of Generative AI techniques, with the ability to quickly learn new ones
Problem-solving mindset and ability to turn ideas into deliverables
Clear communicator, able to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Languages: English + French or Dutch

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🔍 Looking for your next step in Data Science?

Want to use your skills to make a real impact, grow in a supportive environment, and enjoy a healthy work-life balance? We’re looking for a versatile and driven Data Scientist to help us turn data into actionable insights that support smarter decisions across the organization.

💡 What you’ll do:

Build and implement advanced analytics and AI solutions for real business challenges
Work with large, sensitive datasets, while ensuring compliance with data regulations
Translate data into clear, strategic insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate closely across departments — from business to IT
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in AI, GenAI, and data science

👤 What you bring:

A few years of experience in data science or a related field
Strong skills in Python, SQL, and standard data tools
A proactive, analytical mindset and strong problem-solving skills
Clear communication skills in both technical and business contexts
A natural curiosity, team spirit, and eagerness to learn

✨ What we offer:

A varied, impactful role with room to grow through training, coaching, internal mobility, and innovation projects
A flexible hybrid work model (up to 3 days remote), with a great Brussels-based office location
A competitive gross salary with a wide range of extra-legal benefits, including:
▫️ Full insurance package (hospitalization, outpatient care, income protection, pension)
▫️ Meal and eco vouchers
▫️ Internet and homeworking allowance
▫️ Mobility budget or company car
▫️ Year-end premium, collective bonus, and individual performance bonus
▫️ Flexible reward plan tailored to your preferences
▫️ Up to 34 vacation days and flexible working hours

This is more than just a job — it’s a place where your data skills can make a difference, and where your growth and well-being truly matter.

📩 Sound like your kind of challenge? Let’s connect.

#DataScience #AI #Analytics #Hiring #CareerGrowth #HybridWork #MachineLearning #DataJobs #BrusselsJobs #NowHiring

Title: Data Science and AI Expert
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we’re looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it’s designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you’ll help clients unlock value from data.

We’re looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we’d love to talk:


You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM’s or optimization.
You’ve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
You’re comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.


What We Can Offer You


A key role in one of Europe’s leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A company car or mobility budget
Laptop, phone & phone subscription
A competitive salary and indefinite contract
Insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist – Grid Optimization & AI Compliance

About Remobi:

We are Remobi – we empower businesses to scale, innovate, and achieve their goals through high-quality technical solutions delivered by high-performing, high-quality, REMOTE nearshore technology teams. Join our Remobi community to gain access to meaningful, innovative freelance projects and play a key role in shaping how companies operate!




Position Overview:

Location: Fully Remote

Role Type: Freelance/B2B/Contract

Duration: Initial 12 Months




Position Summary:

We’re hiring a Data Scientist to build and deploy reinforcement learning (RL) models that optimize real-time control of energy grid systems. This role focuses on developing scalable, responsible AI solutions that reduce emissions, support compliance, and improve operational efficiency. You’ll work with cutting-edge tools like Grid2Op, L2RPN, and ICTE, integrating your work into cloud-native environments with Python and AWS.

This position suits someone passionate about sustainability, operational AI, and solving complex, real-world challenges.




Responsibilities:

Design, train, and deploy RL models to optimize real-time grid operations.
Use open-source grid simulation platforms (Grid2Op, L2RPN, ICTE) to develop and validate models.
Ensure models comply with regulatory and sustainability standards for AI systems.
Deploy and scale models using AWS services such as SageMaker, Lambda, and S3.
Collaborate with engineers, compliance teams, and energy operations specialists.
Translate technical insights into clear communications for varied stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Proven experience with Reinforcement Learning, ideally applied to physical or control systems.
Advanced Python programming and model deployment skills.
Hands-on use of tools like Grid2Op, L2RPN, ICTE, or similar simulation environments.
Experience deploying models on AWS (SageMaker, Lambda, S3).
Familiarity with smart grid technologies or energy systems is a plus.
Understanding of AI governance, sustainability metrics, or regulatory frameworks.
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or related technical discipline.




If you’re interested in this role or know someone who might be a great fit, feel free to apply or get in touch!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ABOUT US




Konecta is a leading innovative global service provider in customer management business process and digital outsourcing, with 120,000 passionate employees working in 30 languages across 4 continents and 26 countries. Focusing on the unique needs and opportunities of each industry, Konecta offers a full range of end-to-end customer management solutions – including acquisition, retention, customer service, technical support, and collection – all based on a sustainable business model. These services are built on a portfolio of world-class expertise covering customer experience and process management, digital solutions and cutting-edge technologies. Headquartered in Madrid, Konecta delivers global revenues of €2 billion with more than 500 clients, covering some of the biggest names in telecoms, energy, banking, mobility, retail, and e-commerce.




MISSION OF THE ROLE




The Data Scientist in Advisory & Professional Services plays a key role in designing and implementing generative AI solutions that solve real business problems. Working closely with senior data scientists, consultants, and engineers, this role supports the development of prototypes, PoVs, and client-facing solutions using state-of-the-art AI models, agentic frameworks and techniques. The ideal candidate combines hands-on technical ability with curiosity and the drive to create business value through data.




RESPONSIBILITIES




Technical Delivery:

Assist in designing and building Gen AI prototypes using LLMs, embeddings, RAG pipelines, and fine-tuning techniques.
Develop and test agentic workflows using frameworks like LangChain Agents, CrewAI, AutoGen, or Databricks Mosaic AI
Support feature engineering, evaluation, and testing of models in collaboration with architects and engineers.
Create clean, reusable code and Jupyter notebooks that align with internal quality and documentation standards.




Client Collaboration:

Participate in client workshops, discovery sessions, and technical validation phases.
Translate client needs into tractable data science tasks and communicate results clearly.
Collaborate with squads to continuously refine agent behavior, planning strategies, and tool integrations
Support the presentation of prototypes and findings in pre-sales and advisory engagements.




Reusability & Innovation:

Contribute to internal libraries, prompt collections, evaluation frameworks, and demo environments.
Help maintain Gen AI accelerator kits and continuously refine based on project experience.




Governance & Compliance:

Apply responsible AI principles including explainability, fairness, and auditability in project work.
Ensure alignment with the AI governance framework, especially regarding EU AI Act and data protection.




REQUIREMENTS

3–5 years of experience in data science or applied machine learning, preferably in a consulting or client-facing environment.
Hands-on experience with LLM APIs, embeddings, vector databases, and prompt engineering.
Skilled in Python and ML libraries such as LangChain, Hugging Face, scikit-learn, Pandas, and Jupyter.
Familiarity with MLOps concepts and tools like MLflow, DVC, or cloud-based model deployment (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Able to communicate clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Comfortable working with REST APIs, event-driven architectures, and integrating external tools into agent workflows
A team player with an appetite for learning, co-creation, and working in multidisciplinary squads.
Awareness of ethical AI, responsible AI practices, and data privacy guidelines.
Fluent English

  • Create clean, reusable code and Jupyter notebooks that align with internal quality and documentation standards.


Client Collaboration:

  • Participate in client workshops, discovery sessions, and technical validation phases.
  • Translate client needs into tractable data science tasks and communicate results clearly.
  • Collaborate with squads to continuously refine agent behavior, planning strategies, and tool integrations
  • Support the presentation of prototypes and findings in pre-sales and advisory engagements.


Reusability & Innovation:

  • Contribute to internal libraries, prompt collections, evaluation frameworks, and demo environments.
  • Help maintain Gen AI accelerator kits and continuously refine based on project experience.


Governance & Compliance:

  • Apply responsible AI principles including explainability, fairness, and auditability in project work.
  • Ensure alignment with the AI governance framework, especially regarding EU AI Act and data protection.


REQUIREMENTS

  • 3–5 years of experience in data science or applied machine learning, preferably in a consulting or client-facing environment.
  • Hands-on experience with LLM APIs, embeddings, vector databases, and prompt engineering.
  • Skilled in Python and ML libraries such as LangChain, Hugging Face, scikit-learn, Pandas, and Jupyter.
  • Familiarity with MLOps concepts and tools like MLflow, DVC, or cloud-based model deployment (Azure, AWS, GCP).
  • Able to communicate clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Comfortable working with REST APIs, event-driven architectures, and integrating external tools into agent workflows
  • A team player with an appetite for learning, co-creation, and working in multidisciplinary squads.
  • Awareness of ethical AI, responsible AI practices, and data privacy guidelines.
  • Fluent English

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The ideal candidate's favourite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

Analyse raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in relevant field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelling
Deep understanding of predictive modelling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau, Power BI)

  • Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
B.E.S. (Business & Engineering Solutions) is growing and thus welcoming a new Machine Learning Engineer in our Automotive team.




As an Machine Learning Engineer at B.E.S., you will enjoy a collaborative environment where you will work closely with others in an organization that encourages and values collaboration, mentoring, and continuous learning.




Your responsabilities:




Design, develop, and adapt algorithms based on the latest state-of-the-art multimodal models.
Stay up to date with cutting-edge research in deep learning and generative AI.
Implement, optimize, and maintain models, ensuring clean and well-documented code repositories.
Collaborate closely with the researchers and external partners.
Build Proof of Concepts and working prototypes.
Contribute to scientific publications for major conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, CVPR, ECCV).
Support the integration, testing, and deployment of models in real-world environments (cloud, edge, embedded systems).




Your profile:




MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or related field.
2–5 years’ experience in machine learning or deep learning, with a proven research background.
Strong expertise in classical and modern ML/DL methods, foundation models, and Transformer architectures.
Proficient in Python; C++ knowledge is a plus.
Hands-on experience with PyTorch or TensorFlow, Linux, Docker, and Git.
Familiarity with HPC and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).
Skilled in Hugging Face tools (transformers, datasets, tokenizers, Trainer API).
Practical, results-driven, and solution-oriented mindset.
Ability to work under pressure, manage multiple tasks, and deliver high-quality results.
Self-motivated, scientifically curious, collaborative, and an excellent communicator.

What can you except as a B.E.S. consultant?




Great projects in Engineering and High Technologies through major players to develop your technical skills and hard skills,
Knowledge sharing processes though our competences centers and experts' communities to grow your multi-sectorial knowledge,
A strong development plan to improve your soft skills such as Leadership, Communication skills, Change & People management capabilities…
A full package made of gross salary on 13.92 months, lunch allowance, entertainment expenses, company car & fuel card, group insurances OR a freelance contract,
A friendly, lively working environment within a dynamic and motivated team !!

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
About The Role:

We are seeking a skilled AI Integration Engineer to drive the development of AI-driven functionalities in our SaaS platform. You will be responsible for integrating advanced AI tools and features, enabling capabilities such as prompt engineering, autonomous agent creation, and tool development. As we expand, your role will include working with fine-tuned machine learning models and ensuring smooth integration with our existing infrastructure.




Responsibilities

- Lead the integration of AI tools and models into the SaaS platform.

- Develop and implement AI prompt engineering capabilities, enabling admins to create prompts efficiently.

- Build and manage agents that automate tasks, enhance user experience, and improve operational efficiency.

- Design, develop, and maintain tools that leverage AI for business use cases, with an initial focus on raw material sourcing.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product, QA, and designers, to align AI features with business needs.

- Plan and execute the integration of fine-tuned AI/ML models to enhance functionality.

- Continuously evaluate new AI technologies and recommend innovations for future platform updates.

- Ensure that AI models are scalable, secure, and optimized for performance.

- Ensure smooth deployment and monitoring of AI services in production.

- Document AI systems and processes to ensure knowledge sharing across teams.




Minimum qualifications:

- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field.

- 3+ years of experience in AI/ML development and integration.

- Proven experience with prompt engineering, LLMs, and autonomous agent creation (e.g., OpenAI, GPT models).

- Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure, including AI and ML services.

- Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or other relevant languages for AI/ML development.

- Hands-on experience with fine-tuning models, managing datasets, and training custom models.

- Knowledge of NLP (Natural Language Processing), RL (Reinforcement Learning), RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) and generative AI techniques.

- Familiarity with AI infrastructure setup, including orchestration, monitoring, and performance optimization.

- Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred qualifications:

- Experience with SaaS platforms and understanding of sourcing platforms.

- Familiarity with DevOps tools like Docker and GitHub.

- Strong communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative, cross-functional team.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Don’t settle for just any consulting company—choose the one that’s right for you!




We’re on the lookout for a Data Scientist to join our rapidly expanding AI & Data start-up.




At Data Wizards, we are a team of experts in AI & Data who advocate for human-centered AI development and usage. We partner with innovative companies from strategy to implementation to help them achieve their goals by unlocking the full potential of their data assets respecting cultural and ethical norms.




You're making the right choice to apply if you're eager to be part of an ambitious, high-energy team filled with curious, proactive minds who are passionate about AI and driven by integrity.




However, this isn’t the job for you if you’re looking for a routine, copy-paste kind of role. Here, every day is different, and we love people who take initiative, embrace challenges, and think outside the box. 🚀




As a Data Scientist, your mission would include:

Leading the technical aspects of data science projects, from conception to deployment.
Designing and implementing scalable data science solutions that integrate seamlessly with existing infrastructures.
Developing and optimizing machine learning models to drive actionable insights and automation.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including data engineers and business stakeholders, to align technical solutions with strategic goals.
Taking ownership of projects, ensuring high-quality deliverables in an agile environment.
Providing technical leadership and mentorship to junior data scientists.
Engaging in proof-of-concept (PoC) projects and scaling them into production-ready solutions.
Working in cloud-based environments and following MLOps best practices.
Communicating insights and technical solutions effectively to diverse audiences.




You’re a step closer to joining our team if you bring:




Background:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, AI, or a related technical field.
4+ years of experience in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI-driven projects.
Experience in client-facing role, consulting companies are considered as a plus.
Experience in diverse industries and solutions, demonstrating adaptability and problem-solving skills is considered as a plus.




Technical Skills:

Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.
Expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn).
Hands-on experience with big data technologies and cloud platforms (AWS preferred; Azure is a plus).
Experience deploying ML models and following MLOps best practices.
Understanding of data engineering principles to support scalable AI solutions.
Ability to design and implement proof-of-concept (PoC) projects and scale them into production.




Soft Skills:

Autonomous & Proactive: You take initiative and drive projects forward.
Curious & Adaptive: You embrace learning and thrive in dynamic environments.
Solution-Oriented: You balance technical rigor with business impact.
Clear Communicator: You simplify complex ideas for diverse audiences.
Collaborative & Supportive: You work well in teams.
Creative Thinker: You find innovative solutions to challenging problems.




Practical Info:

Languages: Fluent in English. French or Dutch Native.




We know that finding the right job isn’t just about the role—it’s about what’s in it for you, too. While we’re a start-up, we’re big on taking care of our people right from day one.




Here’s a sneak peek at what we offer:




💰 A compensation package that keeps you motivated:

Competitive salary
Mobility budget or company car with a fuel card
30 days of paid time off
A top-tier laptop & smartphone with a subscription
Representation allowances
Hospitalization & dental insurance
Meal vouchers
Opportunity to earn company stock over time




🎯 A place to be your best self, grow, and thrive:

Work with the most innovative technologies in Data & AI
Work in an agile, collaborative environment
Hybrid work model
Monthly team-building events (plus one epic annual celebration)
Tailored training programs to fuel your career growth
A cool, ergonomic office with creative meeting spaces
A Nintendo Switch for spontaneous Mario Kart battles 🎮
A massage chair for those deep-thinking moments 🧘
Fresh coffee & drinks to keep you energized ☕




✨ And most importantly, a fast-growing company where opportunities are limitless!




Our Recruitment Process:

Quick intro call with our HR team
HR Interview
Case study/Technical Interview
Final Interview




How to apply?

You can apply right here on LinkedIn with your CV.




If you’re passionate about what we do but aren’t sure you meet every single requirement—don’t hesitate to apply. We value potential, mindset, and growth as much as experience. At Data Wizards, we believe diversity is our strength. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and experiences because different viewpoints help us grow and evolve.




Let’s build the future of AI & Data, together.




Please note: As a consulting company, our recruitment process can be either project-driven or based on strong profiles we believe in. The consultancy world moves fast, and while we always aim to match great talent with the right opportunity, there might not always be an immediate fit. With your permission, we’ll gladly keep your profile in mind for future missions — and hope to collaborate with you soon on an exciting project at Data Wizards!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Company: SR2 | Socially Responsible Recruitment | Certified B Corporation™
Description:
Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Fully Remote (Europe)

Contract: 6 months (with possible extension)

Start Date: ASAP




We are seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join a cross-functional team driving innovation in clinical data and predictive analytics. This role is ideal for someone who is not only highly skilled in deploying ML models but also thrives on improving architecture, automation, scalability, and product value delivery.




About the Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a key role in operationalizing machine learning models, building production-grade services, and ensuring robust MLOps practices are in place. You’ll work alongside data scientists, engineers, analysts, and DevOps specialists to deliver secure, scalable solutions that streamline and accelerate clinical trial planning and execution.

This is more than just a deployment role—the right person will actively improve systems and processes, ensuring models remain reliable, performant, and impactful.




Responsibilities

Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to develop and deploy machine learning models in production.
Build scalable, secure APIs and batch processes to operationalize ML models.
Create and maintain AWS SageMaker endpoints and ECS services.
Implement MLOps best practices, including CI/CD pipelines, drift detection, and automated retraining.
Enhance architecture, monitoring, and overall production rigor of deployed solutions.
Work closely with stakeholders to define requirements and communicate technical improvements in business-friendly terms.




Must-Have Skills

Python (production-grade, OOP) with libraries such as scikit-learn, torch, pandas, scipy, click, Flask/FastAPI.
AWS SageMaker & ECS for secure deployment and operationalization.
MLOps expertise: CI/CD pipelines, monitoring, drift detection, automation.
Strong knowledge of end-to-end software lifecycle (Dev → Test → UAT → Deploy).
Independent, assertive working style—comfortable operating with minimal supervision.
Product-driven mindset with ability to explain technical concepts to business stakeholders.




Nice-to-Have Skills

Broader AWS experience (S3, EC2, API Gateway, DynamoDB).
Containerization (Docker).
Advanced ML techniques (neural networks, ensemble methods, etc.).
Experience in healthcare, pharma, or life sciences (a plus, not essential).




What We’re Looking For

We want someone who brings technical excellence and initiative—a self-starter who can operate as a “mini CTO” for ML engineering within the team. You should be comfortable not only deploying models but also shaping infrastructure and processes for long-term impact.
