Title: Data Science Specialist
Description:
Crossing Hurdles is a recruitment firm. We refer top candidates to our partners working with the world’s leading AI research labs to help build and train cutting-edge AI models.




Position: Data Science Expert – AI Research

Type: Hourly Contract

Compensation: $70–$100/hour

Location: Remote

Duration: 5–6 weeks initially (with potential for extension)

Commitment: Part-time (~20 hrs/week, flexible)




Role Responsibilities

Evaluate AI-generated data analysis for quality, accuracy, and relevance.
Conduct statistical analysis and modelling for both specific and open-ended prompts.
Design prompts and create detailed rubrics for reward modelling and evaluation.
Produce gold-standard responses, including data visualizations, explanatory notes, and executable Python code.
Translate data science reasoning, decision-making, and expertise into gradable criteria for AI agents.




Requirements

Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent, OR 2+ years of relevant industry experience.
Proficiency in Python data science libraries (e.g., pandas, numpy, scikit-learn).
Strong understanding of data analysis techniques, statistical modelling, and machine learning principles.
Ability to identify patterns and trends in complex datasets and communicate insights clearly.
Excellent analytical and data-driven writing skills.




P.S. – Accept the CrossingHurdles referral invite pop-up during the application process so we can keep you posted and help you with any issues or questions.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
💼Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer

👨 💻Job Type: Freelance

📍Location: Europe

💼Work regime: 100% Remote

🔥Keywords: Machine learning, Python, AWS, and CI/CD pipeline




Position Overview:

As a Machine Learning Engineer at client, you will be a key player in a cross-functional team of data scientists, data engineers, analysts, and DevOps engineers across our Clinical department. You will support our data scientists, helping them operationalize machine learning models and develop high-quality, scalable API services and/or batch processes. Your work will play a critical role in our efforts to deliver predictive analytics for streamlining and accelerating clinical trial planning and execution strategies.




What you'll do:

Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to develop and deploy machine learning models.
Build and maintain scalable machine learning solutions in production.
Create secure AWS SageMaker Endpoints and ECS services to operationalize machine learning models.
Develop and maintain secure, robust, and scalable data and model pipelines.
Implement MLOps best practices regarding data and model drifts checks to ensure data quality and model accuracy and reliability via appropriate monitoring and troubleshooting.
Integrate MLOps checks and stages (e.g., automated model deployment following successful re-training) within the CI/CD pipeline.
Collaborate with other teams to define request and response formats for services and define the appropriate AWS service to use, depending on the use case.
And other duties as assigned, such as enhancing the production rigor, performance, and scalability, of the codes deployed, etc.




What you bring:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, STEM, or a related field. Equivalent professional experience will also be considered.
At least 3 years of professional experience in Machine Learning Engineering, with a focus on deploying secure and robust models in production.
Strong production-grade programming skills in Python, with experience in libraries such as scikit-learn, torch, pandas, scipy, click, and flask and/or FastAPI. (Python - )
Experience with the AWS ecosystem, specifically with services like SageMaker and ECS. (AWS, Sage Maker - )
Experience working in a cross-functional team in a professional setting.
Good understanding of software development lifecycle and practices, including Git and version control, code reviews, and functional, unit and integration testing.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.

Bonus points if you have experience in:

Experience managing the lifecycle of a machine learning model, including updates, tuning and retraining. (End to end life cycle project)
Familiarity with AWS services beyond SageMaker and ECS, such as S3, EC2, API Gateway, ECR, and DynamoDB. (Extra AWS- )
Experience working with large and complex data sets, including data cleaning and preprocessing.
Knowledge of advanced machine learning techniques (neural networks, ensemble learning, reinforcement learning, etc.) and the ability to implement them in Python.
Experience with Docker or other containerization technologies.
Familiarity with CI/CD processes, especially as applied to ML operations (MLOps), preferably with Azure DevOps.
Background or interest in pharmaceutical data, life sciences, or healthcare.




A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description – Senior MLE/MLOps Engineer

Location: ING Belgium

Experience Level: 7+ years

ING Belgium is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our squad. In this role, you’ll help design and automate robust ML pipelines, productionize models, and ensure smooth deployment and monitoring of ML solutions that drive customer impact.

You’ll work closely with data scientists and engineers to operationalize ML workflows, ensuring reproducibility, scalability, and performance. While tools like Docker and Kubernetes are a plus, our current stack focuses more on cloud-native services and automation frameworks.

We value engineers who bring strong technical skills and a customer-first mindset. Understanding business needs and translating them into scalable ML solutions is key to success in this role.

Key Responsibilities


Build and automate ML pipelines (CI/CD, CT) for training, evaluation, and deployment
Productionize ML models into clean, modular, and maintainable code
Implement versioning and governance for data, code, and models
Monitor model performance, data drift, and system health
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver end-to-end ML solutions


Must-Have Skills


7+ years of experience in ML engineering or MLOps
Strong Python and SQL skills
Experience with Apache Spark or equivalent for large-scale data processing
Hands-on with CI/CD tools (e.g., Azure DevOps)
Familiarity with MLOps frameworks, model registries, and experiment tracking
Proficiency with Git for version control


Nice-to-Have Skills


Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and ML monitoring tools
Understanding of ML fundamentals and algorithms (regression, classification, clustering)
Familiarity with libraries like scikit-learn, pandas
Ability to understand and translate business needs into technical solutions


Soft Skills


Strong customer focus and stakeholder collaboration
Ability to align technical solutions with business objectives


, ING Bank

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About

A precision medicine startup is building a team to apply cutting-edge AI to immune-mediated diseases, transforming research into real-world clinical solutions. The role involves developing and deploying LLM- and RAG-powered systems that drive decision-making in diagnostics, treatment, and drug development.

Responsibilities


Model Development: Design and optimise transformer-based models for clinical, transcriptomic, or histology data, focusing on pretraining, fine-tuning, and large-scale benchmarking.
ML Infrastructure: Build scalable ML pipelines and deploy models with MLOps best practices (versioning, monitoring, retraining).
Data Scaling: Convert raw data into scalable, deep learning–ready loaders for millions of datapoints.


Requirements:


Master’s or PhD in ML, Computer Science, or related field
3+ years with deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX)
Strong Python skills; experience with production ML (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/GCP/Azure)
MLOps/DevOps: ML pipelines (e.g., Kubeflow, MLflow), Git, CI/CD, IaC
Experience in GPU programming, distributed training, and model optimisation


NOTE: VISA SPONSORSHIP IS NOT PROVIDED.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance AI Speech Recognition Engineer Role - Brussels




My client are building cutting-edge voice technology track and monitor customer voice to develop insights to use in future use cases. From real-time transcription to multilingual voice assistants, my client design intelligent systems that inform future practices.




Design, build, and optimize end-to-end speech-to-text (STT) and natural language understanding (NLU) pipelines.
Fine-tune and evaluate ASR models (e.g. Wav2Vec 2.0, Whisper, Kaldi, or DeepSpeech).
Implement speaker diarization, noise reduction, and language modeling techniques.
Collaborate with product teams to integrate real-time transcription and voice services into production systems.
Drive innovation in voice AI with research and experimentation in neural acoustic modeling, beam search decoding, or self-supervised learning.




Must have experience with Speech Recognition and/or Speech-to-Text data




The role is Brussels based
Project is planned to last 3 years
Hybrid working
Large client with real world impact




If this role is of interest to you, please apply here I will give you a call and get your interview booked in ASAP!

Title: Data Science Manager AI
Description:
In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.




What is the job about?

Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutionsGathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…




Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:

Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch and English is required. (French is a plus)




We offer

As a certified Top Employer we offer:

An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.

Show more

We are seeking an AI Developer to join our client’s team, focusing on computer vision and image recognition solutions for global terminal automation. You will design, build, and optimize deep learning models to support their products.

Write and maintain production-ready code for AI-driven applications

Analytical problem-solver with strong communication skills in Dutch and English

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NORRIQ is an international group based in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to unlocking the full business potential of companies through technology and digital transformation.

We have a specialized Financial Services practice that is experiencing rapid growth. Over 100 consultants focus exclusively on the financial services sector, assisting banks and insurances in redesigning their operations to meet changing client expectations, adopt new technologies, and adhere to evolving regulations (DORA, RIS, AI Act, AML, KYC, etc).

At NORRIQ, our employees are at the heart of our organization and our success.. We hire and nurture passionate individuals who strive for excellence for both our clients and colleagues. Our culture supports personal and professional growth with training, opportunities, and creative freedom. Regardless of when you join or how long you stay, you'll experience an unforgettable NORRIQ journey and become a part of our extended family. Connected forever!

Role Overview

As an MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between Data Science and IT operations. Your primary responsibility will be to deploy, monitor, and optimize machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring seamless integration into the organization’s infrastructure. You will also contribute to lifecycle management, scalability, and performance optimization of AI systems.

Key Responsibilities


Model Deployment: Collaborate with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models for production, ensuring adherence to best practices for security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated and efficient data pipelines to support continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Assist teams in setting up projects by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment.
Data Flow Design: Establish and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, regular updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Use Kubernetes to manage and streamline the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource utilization and system reliability.
Incident Management: Promptly handle incidents, troubleshoot issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders while conducting root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Explore innovative solutions to enhance AI capabilities and streamline model integration processes.


Requirements

Education


Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Substantial knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.


Technical Expertise


Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have : SQL, PostgreSQL, Mlflow, Helm charts.


Soft Skills


Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Language Proficiency


Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.


Why Joining Us?


You will be part of a fast growing international company with a unique people culture
A very competitive salary package including a company car, iPhone and different allowances
You will get extensive trainings in Belgium and Denmark on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.
Show more

Strong knowledge of GCP (Compute Engine, Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Functions, etc.)

  • Experience as a Machine Learning
  • Strong knowledge of GCP (Compute Engine, Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Functions, etc.)
  • Programming skills in Python, Java, Go, or Node.js
  • Proficiency with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and CI/CD tools (Cloud Build, Azure Pipelines)
  • Understanding of cloud security (IAM, encryption, container security)
  • Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code and automation
  • GCP certifications preferred

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken?




Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)?




Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?




Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?




Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Title: BE-Data Scientist
Description:
Who are we?

Collaboration Betters The World ( CBTW ), is a company providing tech et business solutions to its clients, thanks to its expertise through 9 service lines.

As a Data Scientist, you will join our Data Analytics & AI service line, where we are supporting organizations every step of the way to become data-driven.

Responsibilities

What is your role?

You will be part of a journey where you will have two impacts: a client impact and an internal impact. For the internal impact, based on your skills and time, you will be joining our internal data community at CBTW, to share knowledge and best practices. For the client impact, tasks can vary depending on the client and the project, but as a Data Engineer, you will mainly:


Mining both structured and unstructured data to identify patterns and provide information through predictive models
Explore and collect data from multiple sources to apply or develop analytical ad statistical methods and machine learning models
Apply statistics and machine learning algorithms to discover patterns in datasets


Qualifications

What is your profile?

You


Have at least a bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, economics or in another relevant field
Have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role
Know technologies such as Python, Tensorflow, Pandas, Numpy SQL, Random Forest, neural networks, etc.
Speak English, Dutch and French
Will be an outstanding candidate if you share our values: Positive Thinking, Collaboration, Evolution & Commitment.


What are we offering?

Evolution


Personal follow-up during your career at CBTW and buddy-ship program during your first 6 months
Catalogue with a wide variety of trainings for hard- and soft skills, private language classes, unlimited access to an E-learning platform (Udemy, O'reilly,…) and possibility to get certified every year (Azure, AWS, Prince2, etc.)


Collaboration


On top of the data community, you can join one of the passion communities and practice your hobby or share your interests with other positive thinkers
International collaboration, possibility to work worldwide


On Top Of That


Competitive salary with a flexible mobility package (variety of choice between electrical cars, electrical bikes, payment of rent/mortgage...)
You will become part of a growing team of people keen on applying the latest technologies and knowledge. You will be able to work in a dynamic, innovating environment with the proper touch of geekiness and yearning for board games.


Do you see a match? We would love to see your application coming in! 😉

Title: Machine Learning Engineer $75 – $125/hr Remote EU
Description:
Machine Learning Expert

Remote | Hourly Contract | $75 – $125 per hour

Role Overview

Experienced Machine Learning professionals are invited to contribute to a collaboration with a leading AI research lab. The role involves applying expertise in model training, optimization, and evaluation to support the development of advanced AI systems designed to replicate real-world workflows across engineering and data science.

Key Responsibilities

Evaluate AI-generated machine learning outputs for accuracy, quality, and alignment with project objectives.
Calibrate AI processes across tasks such as model training, performance optimization, and pipeline evaluation.
Design, build, and refine machine learning models and data processing pipelines.
Collaborate with researchers and engineers to iterate on architectures, training strategies, and deployment methods.

Ideal Qualifications

2+ years of professional experience in machine learning, ideally in deep learning, data science, or large-scale AI systems.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or related field; advanced degrees (MSc, PhD) are a plus.
Strong proficiency with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Solid understanding of large-scale data processing, training pipelines, and system optimization.
Excellent analytical and communication skills, with the ability to translate complex ML workflows into clear, actionable insights.

Project Timeline

Start Date: Immediate
Duration: 1–2 months
Commitment: ~20 hours/week (part-time), with potential extension to 40 hours/week
Schedule: Fully remote, asynchronous, flexible working hours

Compensation & Contract

Rate: $75–$125/hour (based on experience)
Performance Bonus: Weekly incentives of $20–$100/hour for top performers
Contract Type: Independent contractor
Payment: Daily via Stripe Connect

Application & Onboarding Process

Upload your resume.
Complete a short AI interview (~15 minutes, conversational, no preparation needed).
Participate in a paid 3-hour work trial assessing your ability to interpret project guidelines and deliver ML-specific outputs.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Based in Belgium)
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!

At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of data-driven decisions?




About the job

🤠 What you’ll be doing

Lead the design and implementation of advanced machine learning models to solve high-impact business challenges
Architect and build robust, scalable data pipelines and data-driven solutions
Drive exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, correlations, and strategic insights
Develop and maintain complex predictive models, recommendation engines, and optimization algorithms
Translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations for business leaders
Validate, monitor, and continuously improve model performance in production environments
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers and business stakeholders, to ensure data quality and alignment with business goals
Mentor and guide junior data scientists, fostering technical excellence within the team
Play a strategic role in shaping Movify’s data science vision, methodologies, and best practices







🤓 Skills & qualifications

5+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar advanced analytics role
Expert proficiency in Python or R, with a strong command of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Deep expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) and experience deploying models in production
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large, complex datasets in real-world environments
Solid background in statistics, probability, and hypothesis testing, with the ability to design rigorous experiments
Practical experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control tools (e.g., Git)
Exceptional ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including C-level audiences
A strategic, proactive mindset with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Fluent in FR or NL + excellent command of English
A genuine passion for transforming data into business value and driving strategic decision-making







😍 Movify Offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology, data, and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Are you a skilled ML Engineer ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in machine learning to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.

🔥 Your Responsibilities:



Design, build, and train machine learning models to address complex business problems.
Fine-tune model performance through feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and validation techniques.
Develop pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production, ensuring reliability and scalability.
Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to align model outcomes with strategic goals.
Stay up to date with emerging ML techniques and tools, contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.



🎯 Your Profile:

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in machine learning and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.



Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and model evaluation techniques.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
Experience with cloud-based ML platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML).
Proven track record in deploying machine learning models at scale.



🚀 Advantages:



An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.



💡 We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE’s core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients’ most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients. You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels. 02

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as: data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Willingness to travel up to 50%
Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred
Show more
HTML:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist.
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist

Description Du Poste

Dans l'équipe AI&Analytics Solutions, nous voulons nous assurer que nous plaçons la prise de décision intelligente (augmentation humaine ou automatisée) au premier plan de nos processus/parcours en établissant une culture de données et d’expérimentation qui pourrait finalement devenir un avantage concurrentiel dans le monde en rapide évolution d’aujourd’hui.

Avez-vous une passion pour découvrir des insights à partir de données et les transformer en solutions impactantes ? Êtes-vous enthousiaste à l'idée de créer de la valeur commerciale à partir de données ?

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist dans notre équipe, vous allez :

• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes pour comprendre et formuler leurs défis en tant que problèmes analytiques.

• Appliquer le machine learning, les méthodes statistiques et les techniques d’optimisation pour développer des solutions innovantes qui impactent l'entreprise.

• Concevoir, construire et évaluer des modèles prédictifs et prescriptifs, en assurant leur fiabilité et robustesse.

• Diriger le cycle de vie complet des produits ML : de l'idéation et du prototypage à la mise en production et à l’évaluation continue.

• Collaborer avec d’autres Data Scientists pour partager des connaissances, bonnes pratiques, et améliorer continuellement nos méthodologies.

• Garantir la qualité et la performance de vos solutions par des tests rigoureux et une surveillance continue après déploiement.

• Contribuer à notre communauté data science en développant des ressources réutilisables, en partageant votre expertise et en participant à des initiatives d’innovation.

Profil

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist, vous avez :

• Au moins 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist/ML Engineer ou dans un rôle analytique similaire.

• Un master dans un domaine pertinent (ex. Mathématiques appliquées, Statistiques, Data Science, Physique, Informatique).

• Une solide connaissance pratique du machine learning, des statistiques et des techniques d’optimisation, avec une expérience concrète dans leur application à des problèmes réels. Expérience dans le développement, l’évaluation et le déploiement de solutions data science de bout en bout.

• Maîtrise de Python et des bibliothèques data science courantes.

• Familiarité avec les environnements de cloud computing.

• Excellentes compétences en communication, capables d’expliquer des concepts complexes à des audiences techniques et non techniques.

• Maîtrise de l’anglais, ainsi que du French ou Dutch.

Et vous êtes également :

• Passionné par la résolution de problèmes d’affaires avec des données et de l’analytics.

• Orienté résultats, capable de concilier excellence technique et besoins business.

• Curieux et désireux d’apprendre et d’expérimenter continuellement avec de nouvelles techniques.

• Collaboratif et capable de prospérer en équipe.

• Proactif, analytique et orienté solutions.

AXA souhaite refléter la diversité de la société dans laquelle nous vivons et mène donc depuis des années une politique active en faveur de la diversité, de la non-discrimination et de l'égalité des chances. Dans ce cadre, nous garantissons un suivi égal et un accès équitable au recrutement, indépendamment de l'âge, de l'origine, du contexte culturel, du handicap, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle ou d'autres caractéristiques.

AXA Belgique

Nous sommes plus de 3000 employés, travaillant dans nos bureaux modernes situés à Bruxelles, Anvers, Eupen et Liège. Nous servons 3 millions de clients en partenariat avec 3200 courtiers et nous sommes fiers d’être le premier assureur auto du pays. Notre ambition est de ne pas seulement être un payeur, mais plutôt un véritable partenaire pour nos clients.

Nos quatre valeurs principales nous poussent chaque jour à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes pour nos clients, tout en collaborant efficacement avec nos collègues: Customer First, Integrity, Courage et One AXA

Chez AXA, nous rejetons toute forme de discrimination déloyale ou illégale. Plus d’informations sur notre politique de Diversité et d’Inclusion.

Ce que nous vous offrons

Une rémunération et des avantages en lien avec votre travail

Vous bénéficierez d’un salaire compétitif, complété éventuellement d’un bonus discrétionnaire lié au résultat personnel et d’un bonus collectif, avec des chèques-repas, des écochèques, du remboursement total des transports en commun et un plan cafétaria.

Tous les avantages d’un assureur comme employeur

Vous bénéficierez d’une assurance pension et d’une assurance hospitalisation et soins ambulatoires (également à un tarif préférentiel pour les membres de votre ménage) ainsi que d’une réduction allant jusqu'à 30 % sur nos autres produits d'assurance.

Un emploi qui s'adapte à votre vie et à vos rêves

Un horaire flexible de 35 heures par semaine, 36 jours de congé par an pour vous ressourcer, ainsi que la possibilité de travailler à la maison jusqu'à 3 jours par semaine.

Vous bénéficierez de cours de sport au travail, de programmes de bien-être pour les employés et de formations, afin de vous maintenir en pleine forme, tant physiquement que mentalement.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Support the Biocartis organization by performing data analysis needed for product development (assays, instruments, manufacturing line…), QC release and on market support
Support assay development teams by developing decision trees that will be integrated in assay specific software
Support assay development teams (internal and partner) with assay specific script development and writing
Support the assay development teams with respect to scientific software tools and data management.




Accountabilities

Develops tools and methods to facilitate analysis of the data generated during:
Assay Development
Cartridge production (including raw materials and semi-finished products)
Instrument production
Field usage
Develops the decision tree that will be integrated in the assay specific software
Writes assay specific software for our Idylla platform (LUA scripting, xml) in support of new assay development requirements of R&D and IVD. This includes definition of methods and data treatment algorithms and documentation.
Performs data mining tasks, statistical analyses and assist other project team members with these tasks
Keeps abreast of latest developments in bioinformatics tools to ensure state-of-the-art environment
Works as a member of a team, is responsible for organizing own time and resources in an optimal fashion. Prioritizes assigned projects and manages time accordingly. Is able to handle more than one project simultaneously
Provides planning input and estimations for their work to support the assay PM (project planning), functional lead and Bio IT manager (resource planning)
Works autonomously as a Bio IT lead for projects
Identifies improvement projects to make sure that the Bio-IT knowledge and capabilities stay in line with the Biocartis roadmap
Supports yearly R&D budget submission in line with general guidelines received, and recommend subsequent budget changes where necessary
Coaches Data Scientists from technical and process point of view
Applies industrialization and GxP expertise to build robust and reliable assays
Independent review of Bio IT related activities in technical and design review meetings




Profile requirements

Master in Bio-Informatics or Master in other life sciences discipline, Informatics, Applied Mathematics with experience in computational biology or equivalent through training/experience.
Basic knowledge of :

-Risk analysis and mitigation

-Controlled development according to planning, work instructions and procedures

Expert knowledge of:

-SW Development Lifecycle: planning, requirements, design, implementation, verification

-Assay industrialization and GxP

-Validation

-Agile Scrum

Biocartis specific :

-Expert knowledge of Idylla Platform (Console, Instrument, Cartridge, Idylla SW eco sphere, ...)

-Profound knowledge of ASSW development (TTP, MessagePack, DT, Reporting, ...)

-Expert knowledge of Biocartis QMS & SW Development standards

Expert knowledge of:

-Data visualization (Spotfire is a plus)

-Statistics

-Machine learning (classification, regression, …)

-Deep Learning

-Science skills (Electronics, software, mechanics, chemistry, physics, optics, thermodynamics, fluids)

Programming skills such as:

-Scripting (LUA, Python)

-Mathematical programming ( R )

-Data analysis

Basic knowledge of:

-SQL query

-non-relational databases (Big data) is a plus

-Molecular Biology

Good communication skills:
Communicates with persuasion: presents, explains and defends a complex message in a clear and concise way and persuades different stakeholders
Planning & organization:
Time & priority management: plans activities effectively with respect for priorities and deadlines
Analytical thinking:
Conducts ongoing in-depth analyzis to anticipate potential problems and guides others in complex issues
Adaptable to change:
Accepts and implements change and adapts, even in difficult situations
Resilient:
Continues to perform effectively under time pressure and in the face of disappointment, adversity and opposition
PC skills:
General

-Expert knowledge of Spotfire

-Expert knowledge of IBM Synergy & Change, git, Team Foundation Server (TFS)

-Basic knowledge of (S)LIMS

Biocartis specific:

-Profound knowledge of Idylla Studio Library

-Expert knowledge of Idylla Studio

Legislation and regulation: Expert knowledge of applicable IVD legislation and standards (IVD, IEC62305, ISO13485, ccfr21part810,…)
Languages: Fluent in English both written and spoken, knowledge of Dutch is a plus




Our offering

We offer you a challenging job in an exciting environment, working for top entrepreneurs in the biotech industry. You can be part of a very dynamic, young and growing team in a highly innovative environment. You will have freedom to shape your work and shape your job. Your input is highly appreciated. Of course we offer you a fitting compensation package including a Flexible Income Plan and we care about your Wellbeing.

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Freelance Chatbot Engineer – Sports & Betting Analytics




We're hiring a Chatbot Engineer to build LLM-powered conversational tools for a product at the intersection of sports analytics and sports betting. You’ll help surface live insights, betting odds, and cognitive metrics through an intelligent chat interface.




🔧 Tech Stack

Python, FastAPI, LangChain, LlamaIndex
GPT-4, Claude, Mistral
Pinecone, Weaviate, Kafka, Redis, PostgreSQL




✅ You’ll Need

3+ years in chatbot/LLM development
Strong Python + experience with LLM tooling
Experience integrating real-time APIs (sports/betting a plus)

Show more
HTML:
Freelance Chatbot Engineer – Sports & Betting Analytics


We're hiring a Chatbot Engineer to build LLM-powered conversational tools for a product at the intersection of sports analytics and sports betting. You’ll help surface live insights, betting odds, and cognitive metrics through an intelligent chat interface.


🔧 Tech Stack

  • Python, FastAPI, LangChain, LlamaIndex
  • GPT-4, Claude, Mistral
  • Pinecone, Weaviate, Kafka, Redis, PostgreSQL


✅ You’ll Need

  • 3+ years in chatbot/LLM development
  • Strong Python + experience with LLM tooling
  • Experience integrating real-time APIs (sports/betting a plus)

Title: Young Graduate AI Traineeship
Description:
Onze klant biedt op maat gemaakte talent development programs aan net afgestudeerden (of high potentials die reeds een eerste korte werkervaring hebben opgedaan) met als doel hen extra te trainen op soft- en hard skills zodat ze professioneel sterk kunnen groeien gedurende het tweejarig traject dat voor hen wordt uitgestippeld.




Momenteel hebben ze een samenwerking met een vooruitstrevende Belgische speler. De organisatie in kwestie is op zoek naar jonge professionals die zich willen toeleggen op AI-oplossingen om efficiëntie en duurzaamheid te verbeteren.




Job Function




Als AI Trainee krijg je de kans om jouw AI-kennis in de praktijk te brengen en deze verder te ontwikkelen in een intens en leerzaam traject. Je zult actief bijdragen aan diverse projecten die steeds AI gericht zijn.




Naast de praktische ervaring die je zal opdoen tijdens de projecten wordt er doorheen dit traineeship ook veel belang gehecht aan de ontwikkeling van jouw soft skills zodat je als persoon verder kan groeien op professioneel vlak. Daarom worden er doorheen het twee jaar durende traineeship veel extra trainingen gegeven om bijvoorbeeld jouw leadership en andere soft skills verder aan te scherpen.




Kort samengevat, professionele en ervaren coaches zullen u persoonlijk begeleiden om uw soft skills en hard skills verder te ontwikkelen om zo uw carrière in een stroomversnelling te brengen.




Na afloop van het traineeship kan u vast aan de slag binnen de organisatie en zal u er meteen een belangrijke rol kunnen opnemen. Dit kan als expert of als leidinggevende.




Job Requirements




U behaalde een masterdiploma;
U heeft maximum 2 jaar werkervaring;
U bent gepassioneerd door AI en kan een eerste ervaring voorleggen (studies, cursus, project, ...);
U wil graag verder groeien op professioneel en persoonlijk vlak;
U beheerst volgende drie talen: Nederlands, Frans en Engels.




Job Offer




U ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket, maar bovenal zult u grondig getraind worden en zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak heel sterk groeien.
Tijdens dit intensief traineeship krijg je een mix van technische trainingen, praktische ervaring die je zal opbouwen, persoonlijke coaching en heel wat trainingen om jouw softskills verder te ontwikkelen.
Je zal in een innovatieve werkomgeving terechtkomen waarin technologie en AI de toekomst vormgeven.
Na afloop van dit traineeship krijg je een vast contract en zal je binnen de organisatie een belangrijke rol kunnen opnemen.

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist (m/w/d)
Description:
Was erwartet Sie?

Programmierung von KI-Programmen
Analyse und Weiterverwertung von Daten
Identifizierung von Anwendungsbereichen für KI
Datenbasierte Weiterentwicklung von maschinellen Lernprogrammen
Eigeninitiative Umsetzung von KI-Projekten
Schulung und Kapazitätenaufbau im Bereich künstlicher Intelligenz
Testen von neuen Tools und Anwendungen




Was sollten Sie mitbringen?

Nachweisbar tiefgreifende Erfahrung im Bereich der künstlichen Intelligenz, Datenanalyse und maschinellem Lernen
Ein Höchstmaß an Kreativität, Ambition und Zielorientierung
Sehr gute Organisationsfähigkeiten
Strukturierte und detailorientierte Arbeitsweise
Hohe Belastbarkeit




Was bieten wir Ihnen?

Flache Hierarchien und die Möglichkeit, sich mit Ideen einzubringen
Ein agiles, hochprofessionelles, strebsames und wertschätzendes Arbeitsumfeld
Flexibilität und selbstbestimmtes Arbeiten
Arbeit in einem stark wachsenden Unternehmen
Die Möglichkeit, am Erfolg mitzuwirken und davon zu profitieren
Wettbewerbsfähige Vergütung

Umfangreiche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Remote - Europe or Asia)
Description:
Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

One of our partner companies is currently looking for a Senior Data Scientist - B2B based in Europe or Asia.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will join a distributed team focused on unlocking insights that power data-driven decisions for B2B initiatives. You'll work closely with other data scientists and engineers to explore user behavior, design impactful experiments, and develop strategic models that improve customer acquisition, retention, and product development. Your work will directly shape how professionals use digital tools at scale in a rapidly growing market segment. The team values autonomy, documentation, and async-first collaboration, with flexibility for remote work and timezone balance.

Accountabilities:


Analyze user behavior to uncover drivers of activation, engagement, churn, and upgrades
Lead experimentation efforts, including A/B test design and impact attribution
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to surface strategic insights and greenfield opportunities
Develop self-serve analytics tools, dashboards, and data literacy programs
Build and maintain predictive models and use case clustering solutions
Perform ETL tasks and model new data dimensions for strategic decision-making
Attribute product and marketing impact to core KPIs with statistical rigor



Requirements


6+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Python or R, and modern BI/analytics tools (e.g., dbt)
Expertise in statistical methods, experimentation design, and machine learning techniques
Proven experience analyzing large datasets to solve business problems
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain insights to non-technical audiences
Strong stakeholder management and ability to influence cross-functional teams
Passion for continuous learning, fast iteration, and working in a dynamic, async environment



Benefits


Meaningful equity in a profitable tech company
Flexible remote work with sponsored visits to regional offices (Hong Kong or London)
Annual company offsite (e.g., Portugal 2023, Bali 2024)
Comprehensive medical insurance for you and your dependents
Home office and wellness budget (equipment, training, etc.)
Flexible working hours and an async-first work culture



Jobgether hiring process disclaimer

This job is posted on behalf of one of our partner companies. If you choose to apply, your application will go through our AI-powered 3-step screening process, where we automatically select the 5 best candidates.

Our AI thoroughly analyzes every line of your CV and LinkedIn profile to assess your fit for the role, evaluating each experience in detail. When needed, our team may also conduct a manual review to ensure only the most relevant candidates are considered.

Our process is fair, unbiased, and based solely on qualifications and relevance to the job. Only the best-matching candidates will be selected for the next round.

If you are among the top 5 candidates, you will be notified within 7 days.

If you do not receive feedback after 7 days, it means you were not selected. However, if you wish, we may consider your profile for other similar opportunities that better match your experience.

Thank you for your interest!

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
About HireShire




HireShire is a modern staffing and talent acquisition platform helping leading organizations find exceptional talent. We’re now expanding into the Data & Analytics vertical and are looking for curious, driven, and analytical minds to join us as part of our Data Science Internship Cohort.




Role Overview




As a Data Science Intern at HireShire, you will collaborate with our engineering and strategy teams to design data-driven solutions that power smarter hiring, workforce planning, and operational decision-making. This is a hands-on role where you’ll work on real business datasets to build production-ready analytics models and dashboards.




Key Responsibilities




Collect, clean, analyze, and transform structured & semi-structured HR and recruitment datasets
Build predictive models for talent forecasting, attrition risk, and candidate success scores
Develop data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Python, SQL & BI tools
Perform EDA (exploratory data analysis) to uncover insights that inform recruitment strategies
Work with time-series & cohort data for trend analysis and performance metrics
Deploy statistical and ML algorithms (regression, clustering, classification) in scalable pipelines
Communicate findings & recommendations with clear visual and written formats to stakeholders




Requirements




Pursuing (or recently completed) B.Tech/BE/M.Tech/MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields
Proficiency in Python + core libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib/Seaborn, Scikit-learn)
Familiarity with SQL for querying relational datasets
Sound understanding of ML fundamentals – supervised/unsupervised learning methods
Strong statistics foundation – distributions, hypothesis testing, probability
Ability to interpret data, derive insights, and present conclusions clearly
Strong communication skills, ownership mindset & enthusiasm to learn




Nice to Have (Bonus)




Knowledge of BI tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / Metabase)
Basics of cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) or Docker
Prior exposure to HR analytics or recruitment datasets




What You’ll Get




Practical exposure to solving real-world data problems in HR Tech
Experience working on high-impact product features used by recruiters and hiring managers
1:1 mentorship by experienced data scientists and access to premium resources
Internship Certificate & Letter of Recommendation upon successful completion
Opportunity for a Pre-Placement Offer (PPO) at HireShire or client companies




Hiring Process




Online Application

Submit CV, GitHub/Kaggle links, and a brief note on your interest and experience

Technical Assessment

Assignment to test Python, SQL, EDA, or modeling approach

Technical Interview

In-depth discussion (45 mins) on your ML/stats understanding & problem-solving

Managerial Interview

Evaluate communication skills, culture fit & motivation

Offer

Selected applicants receive the internship offer with stipend details & project allocation

Onboarding

Orientation, project assignment & setup with tools and mentors




Stipend

Minimum stipend starts at 18 euro/hour, with the possibility of a higher rate based on performance in the interviews.

Show more
HTML:
About HireShire


HireShire is a modern staffing and talent acquisition platform helping leading organizations find exceptional talent. We’re now expanding into the Data & Analytics vertical and are looking for curious, driven, and analytical minds to join us as part of our Data Science Internship Cohort.


Role Overview


As a Data Science Intern at HireShire, you will collaborate with our engineering and strategy teams to design data-driven solutions that power smarter hiring, workforce planning, and operational decision-making. This is a hands-on role where you’ll work on real business datasets to build production-ready analytics models and dashboards.


Key Responsibilities


  • Collect, clean, analyze, and transform structured & semi-structured HR and recruitment datasets
  • Build predictive models for talent forecasting, attrition risk, and candidate success scores
  • Develop data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Python, SQL & BI tools
  • Perform EDA (exploratory data analysis) to uncover insights that inform recruitment strategies
  • Work with time-series & cohort data for trend analysis and performance metrics
  • Deploy statistical and ML algorithms (regression, clustering, classification) in scalable pipelines
  • Communicate findings & recommendations with clear visual and written formats to stakeholders


Requirements


  • Pursuing (or recently completed) B.Tech/BE/M.Tech/MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields
  • Proficiency in Python + core libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib/Seaborn, Scikit-learn)
  • Familiarity with SQL for querying relational datasets
  • Sound understanding of ML fundamentals – supervised/unsupervised learning methods
  • Strong statistics foundation – distributions, hypothesis testing, probability
  • Ability to interpret data, derive insights, and present conclusions clearly
  • Strong communication skills, ownership mindset & enthusiasm to learn


Nice to Have (Bonus)


  • Knowledge of BI tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / Metabase)
  • Basics of cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) or Docker
  • Prior exposure to HR analytics or recruitment datasets


What You’ll Get


  • Practical exposure to solving real-world data problems in HR Tech
  • Experience working on high-impact product features used by recruiters and hiring managers
  • 1:1 mentorship by experienced data scientists and access to premium resources
  • Internship Certificate & Letter of Recommendation upon successful completion
  • Opportunity for a Pre-Placement Offer (PPO) at HireShire or client companies


Hiring Process


Online Application

  • Submit CV, GitHub/Kaggle links, and a brief note on your interest and experience

Technical Assessment

  • Assignment to test Python, SQL, EDA, or modeling approach

Technical Interview

  • In-depth discussion (45 mins) on your ML/stats understanding & problem-solving

Managerial Interview

  • Evaluate communication skills, culture fit & motivation

Offer

  • Selected applicants receive the internship offer with stipend details & project allocation

Onboarding

  • Orientation, project assignment & setup with tools and mentors


Stipend

Minimum stipend starts at 18 euro/hour, with the possibility of a higher rate based on performance in the interviews.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist

Functiebeschrijving

In het AI&Analytics Solutions team willen we ervoor zorgen dat we slimme besluitvorming (menselijke augmentatie of geautomatiseerd) naar de voorgrond brengen van onze processen/journeys door het opbouwen van een datas en experimentatiecultuur die uiteindelijk een concurrentievoordeel kan worden in de snel veranderende wereld van vandaag.

Heb je een passie voor het ontdekken van inzichten uit data en het omzetten hiervan in impactvolle oplossingen? Ben je enthousiast om zakelijke waarde uit data te halen?

Als Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist in ons team, zal je:


Nauw samenwerken met bedrijfsstakeholders om hun uitdagingen te begrijpen en te vertalen naar analytische problemen.
Machine learning, statistische methoden en optimalisatietechnieken toepassen om innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen die zakelijke impact hebben.
Voorspellende en prescriptieve modellen ontwerpen, bouwen en evalueren, en zorgen voor betrouwbaarheid en robuustheid.
Leiding nemen in de volledige lifecycle van ML-producten: van idee en prototyping tot implementatie en voortdurende evaluatie in productie.
Samenwerken met andere Data Scientists om kennis, best practices te delen en onze methodologieën continu te verbeteren.
Zorgen voor de kwaliteit en prestaties van je oplossingen door rigoureus testen en voortdurende monitoring na deployment.
Bijdragen aan onze data science community door herbruikbare assets te ontwikkelen, je expertise te delen en deel te nemen aan innovatie-initiatieven.


Profiel

Als Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist heb je:


Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist/ML Engineer of een vergelijkbare analytische rol.
Een masterdiploma in een relevant vakgebied (bijv. Toegepaste Wiskunde, Statistiek, Data Science, Natuurkunde, Informatica).
Sterke praktische kennis van machine learning, statistiek en optimalisatietechnieken, met hands-on ervaring in het toepassen ervan op echte problemen. Ervaring met het ontwikkelen, evalueren en implementeren van end-to-end data science oplossingen.
Vaardigheid in Python en gangbare data science libraries
Bekendheid met cloud computing omgevingen.
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe concepten uit te leggen aan zowel technische als niet-technische doelgroepen.
Vloeiend in Engels, evenals in French of Dutch


En je bent ook:


Gepassioneerd over het oplossen van zakelijke problemen met data en analytics.
Resultaatgericht, in staat om technische excellentie te combineren met zakelijke behoeften.
Nieuwsgierig en enthousiast om continu te leren en te experimenteren met nieuwe technieken.
Samenwerkingsgericht en gedijt in teamomgevingen.
Proactief, analytisch en oplossingsgericht.


AXA wil een weerspiegeling zijn van de diverse samenleving waarin wij leven en voert daarom al jaren een beleid van actieve diversiteit, non-discriminatie en gelijke kansen. In dit kader garanderen wij een gelijke behandeling en toegang tot selecties, ongeacht leeftijd, afkomst, culturele achtergrond, handicap, geslacht of seksuele geaardheid of andere kenmerken. Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af.

AXA Belgium

Meer dan 3000 mensen werken bij ons, vanuit onze vooruitstrevende kantoren in Brussel, Antwerpen, Eupen en Luik. We werken samen met 3200 makelaars. We hebben 3 miljoen klanten en zijn nummer 1 in autoverzekeringen. Het is onze ambitie om onze relatie met al onze klanten te transformeren van betaler naar partner om ons echt te onderscheiden.

Onze belangrijkste leidraad zijn onze waarden: Customer first, Integrity, Courage en One AXA. Alles wat we doen, daar staan we als één team achter.

Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af. Meer info in ons Diversiteits- en Inclusiebeleid.

Wat we aanbieden

Een mooie beloning voor je werk

Een competitief loon, eventueel aangevuld met discretionaire persoonlijke en collectieve premies en natuurlijk ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een volledige terugbetaling van het openbaar vervoer en een cafetariaplan.

Alle voordelen van werken bij een verzekeraar

Van groepsverzekering tot ambulante en hospitalisatieverzekering (ook gezinsleden kunnen daarbij aansluiten aan een voordelig tarief) en met tot 30% korting op onze andere verzekeringsproducten. 

Een job die zich aanpast aan je leven en dromen

Een flexibel rooster van 35 uur per week, 36 dagen verlof per jaar om op te laden, evenals de optie om thuis te werken, tot 3 dagen per week.

Wij bieden sportlessen op het werk, welzijnsprogramma's voor werknemers en trainingen, om u in topvorm te houden, zowel fysiek als mentaal.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🤖 The Job

At Dataroots, we couple our excellent consulting services with our technical expertise to build advanced machine learning models to improve business processes across a variety of industries, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be an integral part of our in-house team of AI specialists, designing and implementing models that deliver robust, data-driven solutions for our clients.




Passionate about data, you enjoy diving deep to uncover actionable insights and develop machine learning models that enhance client operations. You’ll experiment with different approaches, while collaborating with Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists to drive the delivery of tailored, high-quality, end-to-end solutions.




You’ll also have the opportunity to mentor colleagues, share knowledge, and stay on top of industry developments through a range of initiatives we support internally.




🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💼 What we’re looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

A deep passion for Machine Learning and a Master’s or PhD in a quantitative discipline.
Strong foundation in software design principles.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in machine learning and big data.
Expertise in machine learning and deep learning, with both a theoretical and practical grasp.
Proficiency in Python & SQL is a must; knowledge of R is an advantage.
Experience with deploying machine learning models and familiarity with MLOps practices.
At least a first experience with AWS, Azure or GCP and a solid understanding of cloud engineering and its use in Machine Learning.
Experience with ML versioning tooling.
Enthusiasm for working with large datasets and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complex technical concepts for clients.
Fluency in English and Dutch.




Don't worry if you don’t meet every requirement from the start. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




💰 The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! 🎉

Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced AI Engineer with a Data Science background to join our professional services team of 50+ engineers. The position is available full-time, with part-time arrangements possible for the right candidate. This remote-first role focuses on Generative AI development, specifically building and deploying advanced Large Language Models (LLMs) and AI agents. You'll work with state-of-the-art foundation models through platforms like AWS Bedrock and GCP Vertex AI to develop innovative GenAI applications and scalable AI infrastructure for our clients.




Key Responsibilities:

Generative AI Development:

Design and implement production-ready generative AI applications and AI agents using foundation models and cutting-edge protocols like MCP and A2A
Fine-tune and optimize LLMs for specific use cases and domains
Create and maintain prompt engineering strategies and evaluation frameworks
Design and deploy autonomous AI agents with targeted capabilities




AI/ML Engineering:

Build end-to-end LLM pipelines for fine-tuning, deployment, and monitoring
Implement RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems
Create efficient vector storage and embedding solutions




Infrastructure and Operations:

Build and maintain robust AI infrastructure using AWS and GCP services
Implement monitoring systems for model performance and infrastructure health
Optimize cloud resources for cost-efficiency while maintaining performance




Preferred Qualifications:

4+ years of experience in AI, machine learning, or data science, with a recent focus on Generative AI
Strong programming skills and experience with LLM and Agent frameworks (LangChain, CrewAI)
Expertise in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) and containerization technologies
Deep understanding of LLM operations, including prompt engineering and RAG
Experience with vector databases and semantic search implementations
Experience building and deploying AI agents using modern frameworks
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities




Employment Options:

Full-time position (40 hours/week)
Part-time arrangements available for qualified candidates (minimum 20 hours/week)




Benefits:

Potential career paths include AI Team Lead
Collaborative remote team environment
Opportunity to contribute to open-source GenAI initiatives and research publications

Show more
