Title: Marktonderzoeker, Data science
Company: CUBE - Consumer and Customer Understanding Belgium
Description:
Voor wie en waarom zoeken we?

Voor een vooraanstaand Belgisch marktonderzoeksbureau, gevestigd in Mechelen, zoeken wij een Marktonderzoeker die een eerste ervaring heeft gehad in onderzoek. We zoeken iemand die in staat is om complexe marketing-vraagstukken op te lossen door het initiëren en begeleiden van gerichte kwantitatieve onderzoekstrajecten. Dit bedrijf hecht waarde aan een warme en familiaire sfeer, waar collega’s dicht bij elkaar staan en waar het creëren van een omgeving waarin iedereen zich betrokken voelt belangrijk is. De missie is gericht op het laten groeien van zowel medewerkers als klanten.

Hoe maak jij het verschil?


Als Research Executive met focus op data-analyse heb je een passie om in data te duiken en ga je ook verder dan de cijfers alleen. Het uitvoeren van analyses is de belangrijkste focus van deze functie. Complexe onderzoeksdesigns en geavanceerde analyses schrikken je niet af.
Je werkt voornamelijk in SPSS maar er is een sterke interesse in andere programmeertalen zoals Visual Basic, R, Python,… Je vindt het leuk om te zoeken naar de meest optimale (geautomatiseerde) manier om aan data-analyse te doen.
Je bent iemand die zich graag in een probleem vastbijt en je houdt ervan om antwoorden te vinden op onderzoeks- of bedrijfsvragen.
Je bent praktisch en georganiseerd, je kan zelfstandig werken op een nauwkeurige, consistente en proactieve manier
Je bent nauwkeurig en precies in je werk
Je bent zelfstandig, gemotiveerd om continu bij te leren en nieuwe analysetechnieken eigen te maken
Je hebt interesse in de menselijke psyche en je denkt graag na over marketingvraagstukken, je legt graag verbanden en houdt van puzzelen tot aan de oplossing


Je taken


De focus voor deze functie ligt op het uitvoeren van analyses op data afkomstig uit kwantitatief onderzoek:
Programmeren en testen van vragenlijsten
Opmaken van onderzoekstabellen
Basisanalyse van data in SPSS (datacleaning, datamanipulaties)
Data-herstructuren als voorbereiding voor complexe analyses (SPSS icm Python, R)
Geavanceerde analyses uitvoeren in SPSS (regressie, correspondentie, clustering, …)
De onderzoeksonderwerpen kunnen sterk variëren, zowel qua marketingonderwerp (innovatie-onderzoek, klantentevredenheid, communicatie,…) als qua sector (energie, overheid, telecom, FMCG, media…). Na een inwerkperiode kan je doorgroeien naar een Senior functie waar je volledig de projecten zelfstandig zal opvolgen (in samenwerking met de manager voor begeleiding & coaching).

Wie zoeken we?


Je bent gepassioneerd door data en analyses
Je bent nauwkeurig en hebt oog voor detail
Je bent iemand die graag op zoek gaat naar hoe een data-analyse beter en sneller kan
Je beschikt over een Masterdiploma (Psychologie, Sociologie, Toegepaste Economische Wetenschappen, Marketing, Handelswetenschappen…) of vergelijkbaar Bachelor-diploma
Je houdt van technologie en digitale transformatie. Alle tools, sociale media, apps en software die kunnen helpen om ons vak naar een hoger niveau te tillen.
Ervaring is een pluspunt maar niet noodzakelijk: wij investeren in jouw persoonlijk groeipad, zowel als marktonderzoeker als je analyse- en communicatievaardigheden in het algemeen
Je bent een echte teamplayer. Onze waarden zijn nieuwsgierigheid, respect en vertrouwen.


Wat hebben we in de aanbieding?


Een sterk groeiend bedrijf met ondertussen 10 werknemers, waar je volop kansen krijgt om mee te groeien en waar je direct een grote impact kan hebben op de resultaten.
Je komt terecht in een hecht team van collega’s met veel expertise en passie voor hun job, die opleidingen en mogelijkheden tot bijleren stimuleren.
Teamspirit wordt hoog in het vaandel gedragen, waarbij er ook regelmatig afterworks, teametentjes, een kerstfeest, … georganiseerd worden.
Het bedrijf is gelegen op een goed bereikbare locatie (Mechelen Zuid), en ze bieden een hybride werkomgeving waar je kantoor- en telewerk kan combineren.
Last but not least bieden ze je uiteraard een mooi & competitief maandsalaris aan.


Cultuur en missie

De bedrijfscultuur is warm en familiaal, waarbij iedereen dicht bij elkaar staat en er rekening gehouden wordt met de menselijke aspecten. De missie is gericht op het laten groeien van zowel onze medewerkers als klanten. Ze benaderen ontwikkeling op een persoonlijke manier, waarbij ze individuele groei centraal stellen. Ze streven ernaar mensgerichte personen aan te trekken, waarbij er geen ruimte is voor competitie of ego’s. Het team staat boven het individu, en er is een fel geloof dat dit de sleutel is tot gezamenlijk succes.

Interesse om te solliciteren? Neem contact op met Milan Pelgrims.
Show more

Title: Junior consultant – Strategie & Organisatie
Description:
De opportuniteit




Heb jij zin om een maatschappelijke stempel te drukken? Ben je vertrouwd met de werking van overheden of heb je interesse om deze te leren kennen? Bezit je een goede dosis people skills en ben je enthousiast om uitdagende projecten aan te gaan?




Dan ben jij misschien de persoon die we zoeken. Bij IMPACT public sector advisors zijn we op zoek naar een junior consultant die wil bijdragen aan een performante overheid en non-profitsector.




Functie




Je leidt eigen projecten binnen jouw expertisegebied en stuurt op termijn een beperkt projectteam aan 
Je overlegt met de klant om de meest gepaste oplossing en strategie te vinden  
Je leidt workshops met klanten en stakeholders
Je wordt ingeschakeld om nieuwe opportuniteiten te detecteren en binnen te halen 




Profielvereisten




Je hebt een masterdiploma
Je hebt tussen 2 en 4 jaar relevante ervaring binnen consulting of projectmanagement in (één of verschillende van) volgende domeinen: organisatiestrategie (bepalen van missie, visie, strategische en operationele objectieven, …), organisatieontwikkeling (personeelsplanning, organisatiedesign, …), procesmanagement (optimalisatie, interne audit, interne controle,..), veranderingsmanagement, programma- en projectmanagementnt
Je hebt affiniteit met de publieke sector (ervaring is een pluspunt)
Je communiceert helder en hebt een goede schrijfstijl
Je bent vloeiend in het Nederlands en je hebt kennis van het Frans
Je bent in staat om snel persoonlijk vertrouwen op te bouwen door je expertise aan te tonen
Je hebt een sterk analytisch vermogen om complexe problemen aan te kaarten met inzichtvolle, praktische en gestructureerde oplossingen.
Je bent een teamspeler
Je hebt een positieve houding en gevoel voor humor




IMPACT – Wie zijn we en waar staan we voor?




Het DNA van IMPACT wordt gekenmerkt door de wens om echte meerwaarde te creëren voor de maatschappij. We maakten de keuze om ons te richten op overheden (zowel lokaal, gewestelijk, federaal als Europees) en de non-profitsector die dit expliciet als doelstelling hebben. Wij willen hen ondersteunen in hun missies door onze expertise aan te wenden voor de grote vraagstukken waar zij voor staan. Zo hopen we bij te dragen aan positieve verandering.




We hebben een bewezen trackrecord voor diverse klanten in uitdagende projecten rond strategie en verandering, operationalisering en evaluatie. 




Wat we bieden




Een klein, maar hecht team van 10 personen, met veel aanwezige expertise

Een omgeving waarin je wordt uitgedaagd om het beste uit jezelf te halen met veel boeiende, maatschappelijk relevante projecten 

De vrijheid om je werk zelf te organiseren, te ondernemen en zelf initiatief te nemen.  

De mogelijkheid om te blijven leren en jezelf te ontwikkelen.  

Een aantrekkelijk loon met extralegale voordelen (gsm, laptop, bedrijfswagen, hospitalisatieverzekering,…) 




Wij zijn voor deze vacature op zoek naar een vaste medewerker. Freelanceconsultants zullen niet weerhouden worden. 




Solliciteren voor dez functie kan enkel door CV en motivatiebrief te bezorgen via elisabet.okmen@impactconsulting.be

Show more

Title: Technoloog Biomedisch laboratorium Hematologie-Chemie
Description:
Onderneming

De dynamische equipe van het Biologische Klinische labo – departement Hematologie – (ISO-geaccrediteerd 15189) zoekt een gemotiveerde collega om kwalitatieve medische analyses te garanderen.

De Europa Ziekenhuizen, geaccrediteerd door JCI, zijn een referentieziekenhuis voor Brussel en omgeving. Als meertalig algemeen ziekenhuis bieden wij een volledig zorgaanbod aan op onze beide sites (St-Elisabeth in Ukkel en St-Michiel in Etterbeek/Europese Wijk) en onze twee poliklinieken (Bella Vita Medisch Centrum in Waterloo en Inkendaal).

In onze instelling worden dagelijks 2500 patiënten verzorgd. Onze 300 specialisten en 1800 personeelsleden zetten dag na dag hun competenties voor hen in om, met respect voor eenieder, een doeltreffende en correcte diagnose te stellen, een aangepaste behandeling voor te stellen en een gepersonaliseerde benadering te waarborgen. Wij kunnen hiervoor een beroep doen op geavanceerde medische technologie in een moderne infrastructuur zodat we aan elke patiënt de beste zorgkwaliteit kunnen bieden, in alle veiligheid en met maximaal comfort.

Functie

In Samenwerking Met De Directie Van Het Labo, Het Administratieve Personeel En De Andere Technologen, Neem Je De Volgende Verantwoordelijkheden Op Binnen De Dienst


Hematologie met een polyvalentie in chemie en de bloedbank
Verfijnen van nieuwe technieken
Betrokkenheid bij het accreditatieproces voor ISO 15189


Na een periode van begeleiding en vorming, ontwikkel je je tot een professionele technoloog in een modern labo, gebruik makend van vooruitstrevende technologie.

Profiel


Je hebt een bachelor biomedische laboratorium-technologie met een WIV erkenning (of in procedure)
Een eerste ervaring in de sector is een meerwaarde
Tweetaligheid Frans-Nederlands is een pluspunt
Je bent dynamisch, georganiseerd, betrouwbaar, zelfstandig en stressbestendig
Je hebt een scherp onderscheindingsvermogen bij medische noodgevallen
Je getuigt van echte teamspirit
Je hebt een sterke focus op het behalen van kwaliteitsnormen
Je hebt een goede beheersing van basis IT tools
Je werkt op afwisselende uren (van 7u tot 15u, van 8u tot 16u, van 12u tot 20u, in het weekend en op feestdagen)
Voldoen aan de wettelijke vereisten voor tweetaligheid (FR/NL) of bereid zijn om deze te ontwikkelen (gratis taalcursussen)


Aanbod

Wij Bieden u Een Voltijds Of Deeltijds Vast Contract In Een Modern, Kwaliteitsvol Ziekenhuis. Naast Een Baremieke Verloning Die Een Jaarlijkse Salarisverhoging Garandeert, Een Eindejaarspremie, Alsook Werkzekerheid Binnen Een Ziekenhuis Dat De Patiënt En Zijn Personeel Centraal Stelt, Bieden Wij u


Werken in een ziekenhuis met JCI- accreditatie, de garantie voor een toewijding aan kwaliteitsvolle zorg, patiëntveiligheid en professionele teams
Een DKV hospitalisatieverzekering in België en in het buitenland
Voorkeurtarieven voor medische zorg in onze ziekenhuizen voor u en de mensen van hetzelfde huishouden
Interne en externe opleidingen
Gratis taalopleiding in groep of immersie
Telefoonabonnement betaald door de werkgever na het slagen voor een tweetaligheidstest
Een deel van de kosten van de aangeboden maaltijden wordt betaald door het ziekenhuis
1 extra dag anciënniteitsverlof per 5 jaar, zonder maximumlimiet
Terugbetaling vervoerskosten (openbaar vervoer, fiets, auto)
Exclusieve voordelen dankzij Benefits@Work op aantrekkelijke merken, waarmee u het hele jaar door bespaart
Welzijnsprogramma en organisatie van sportieve uitdagingen en gratis groepslessen (Crossfit, SquadEasy, Run@Work)


Sollicitaties (motivatiebrief en curriculum vitae) moeten worden verzonden via onze website!

Diversiteit in al haar dimensies is een essentiële waarde bij Cliniques de l'Europe. Wij zijn ervan overtuigd dat geslacht, afkomst, leeftijd, seksuele geaardheid, levensovertuiging of handicap allemaal elementen zijn die onze individualiteit en de kracht van onze teams vormen.
Show more
HTML:
Onderneming

De dynamische equipe van het Biologische Klinische labo – departement Hematologie – (ISO-geaccrediteerd 15189) zoekt een gemotiveerde collega om kwalitatieve medische analyses te garanderen.

De Europa Ziekenhuizen, geaccrediteerd door JCI, zijn een referentieziekenhuis voor Brussel en omgeving. Als meertalig algemeen ziekenhuis bieden wij een volledig zorgaanbod aan op onze beide sites (St-Elisabeth in Ukkel en St-Michiel in Etterbeek/Europese Wijk) en onze twee poliklinieken (Bella Vita Medisch Centrum in Waterloo en Inkendaal).

In onze instelling worden dagelijks 2500 patiënten verzorgd. Onze 300 specialisten en 1800 personeelsleden zetten dag na dag hun competenties voor hen in om, met respect voor eenieder, een doeltreffende en correcte diagnose te stellen, een aangepaste behandeling voor te stellen en een gepersonaliseerde benadering te waarborgen. Wij kunnen hiervoor een beroep doen op geavanceerde medische technologie in een moderne infrastructuur zodat we aan elke patiënt de beste zorgkwaliteit kunnen bieden, in alle veiligheid en met maximaal comfort.

Functie

In Samenwerking Met De Directie Van Het Labo, Het Administratieve Personeel En De Andere Technologen, Neem Je De Volgende Verantwoordelijkheden Op Binnen De Dienst

Title: Full-stack Developer (EU only)
Description:
Job Description

Important:

Nationality: EU only

Contract: Freelancer

Type: Long-term, Full-time, On-site/Hybrid (living/relocation in Brussels is a must)

Daily Tasks/Responsibilities:


Migrating many applications to a container based model, using jdk 21 spring 6, and docker compose, cleaning up code smells, refactoring complex logics, covering with unit tests basically using mockito and sonarqube, implement a new security layer using spring security + oidc.
Responsible for designing and implementing new features and bug fix following the best market practices.
Monitor and troubleshoot applications using Dynatrace.


Mandatory Experience (perfect fit):


Minimum 11 years of IT-related experience.
Java, WebSphere server, Spring boot, Azure infrastructure (Pipelines, KeyVault), GitHub Devops, RedHat OpenShift, Docker, REST API’s, Swagger, Maven, Junit, Mockito, Checkmarx platform, Cassandra, Oracle/MySQL database, Git, Grafana/ELK stack, Centreon, Prometheus, Service Now, Dynatrace, Sonaqube, Prisma Cloud


Qualifications

Bachelor degree in IT or similar field

Title: Data Scientist 80–100%
Description:
At Sunrise, we think bigger, go further and create new ideas. For us working culture means achieving great things together. It’s where respect and innovative ideas combine with real teamwork – every voice counts, every perspective makes us stronger. Our passion spurs us on to try new things and grow continuously. Sound like you? Then join our success story.

As an exceptional analyst and advisor, your audience will include Sunrise’s senior leaders and decision-makers. You will be able to use your creativity, technical prowess, business acumen and communication skills to solve some of the toughest challenges the company faces. We are looking for someone who thrives on digging into a business domain to find new opportunities, understands the value of rigorous statistical analysis, and turns data into clear, confident decisions. If you like the sound of tackling everything from causal inference problems to simulations that help shape strategy - and if you enjoy teaming up with smart folks across the business to offer advice, challenge ideas, and guide decisions - this role will be a great fit for you.

YOUR CHALLENGE:

Our initiatives are always changing, so here is just a taste of the kind of topics you could be starting with:


Design and run nimble experiments - from study design to actionable insights, for example, we’re exploring new ways to measure how specific products affect customer churn
Simulate market and customer behavior - to advise decision-makers and help shape long-term company strategy
Derive recommendations from data - using a large number of free-text survey responses, identify topic clusters and ideate appropriate actions
Detect outliers in a large number of time series - support the data organization with an early detection tool for master data and data quality issues
Promote and help data-driven decision-making - through upskilling, coaching, and sharing success stories


YOUR SKILLS:


A University degree in a quantitative field (PhD preferred)
2–5 years in a similar role in industry or consulting; project lead experience required for Senior
Deep knowledge of statistics, machine learning and other analytical methods
Proficient in at least one statistical programming language and in SQL
A pragmatic approach when putting together a POC, but a keen eye for detail and a stickler for accuracy when it comes to taking a concept to production
Skilled at communicating and working effectively with non-technical stakeholders across the organization; self-motivated, dependable, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Fluent in English


At Sunrise, you’ll be working in a dynamic and multinational environment where every voice is heard, perspectives are shared and values are lived. Diversity isn’t just a program for us, it’s part of our DNA. By celebrating our differences, we achieve great things together.

Sunrise has partnered with «Advance – Gender Equality in Business». We’ve also been awarded the Swiss LGBTI label and «Fair-ON-Pay Advanced» certification as recognition for offering all our employees equal pay for work of equal value.

Ready to rise to the challenge? Then join the team and actively shape our future!

#ChallengersWanted

Information for agencies: Application dossiers sent or uploaded by placement agencies or similar are not desired, will therefore not be considered and will be deleted.

Title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🚀 We're hiring: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer

🗓 Start: ASAP

📍 Location: Geneva (4 days on-site, 1 day remote)

📅 Duration: Asap - Until end of March 2026




We’re looking for a hands-on and business-minded Data Scientist / ML Engineer to join a dynamic and high-impact team working on real-world machine learning solutions from recommender systems to Generative AI with measurable business ROI.




🎯 Your Mission

As part of a team of engineers, you will be in charge of designing, developing and deploying machine learning algorithms into production, while measuring their value and presenting results to key stakeholders.

Your responsibilities include:

Designing and deploying ML models (recommender systems, classifiers, Generative AI)
Measuring the ROI of models in production and building business case presentations
Building CI/CD pipelines and working closely with Data Engineers
Deploying ML solutions in Vertex AI (GCP)
Managing project milestones and presenting progress and outcomes to leadership




Your Skills

Minimum of 5 years of experience in Data science and Machine learning
Expert in Python and SQL
Solid experience with Git, CI/CD pipelines
Understanding of Airflow, Terraform
Strong business acumen: ability to turn data into business decisions
Comfortable presenting results to non-technical stakeholders
Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform and Vertex AI preferred
Experience with Generative AI in production settings is a big plus
Proficiency in English mandatory (C1 minimum)




Your Background

Master's degree (or higher) in Software Engineering or equivalent
PhD is a plus but not mandatory




If you're passionate about applied AI, enjoy working closely with business teams, and want to deploy impactful models into production, we’d love to hear from you !




📩 Apply directly if you are interessted !




Please note that strong proficiency in English, at least five years of relevant experience, and EU citizenship (as required by Swiss regulations) are essential for this position. Unfortunately, applications not meeting these criteria cannot be considered.




#datascience #machinelearning #vertexai #generativeai #hiring #geneva #gcp #python #recommendersystems #mlengineer #ci_cd

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Are you passionate about AI and eager to drive innovation in a fast-paced, impact-driven environment? Do you have experience developing AI-powered applications and enjoy mentoring others? If so, we invite you to join Nexthink as an AI & ML Engineer!

As a key member of our AI team, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable AI solutions, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance digital employee experiences for millions worldwide.

Responsibilities


Lead AI Development – Design and implement AI-powered products, with a strong focus on Agentic systems.
LLMs done right – Create evaluations and define metrics of success using cutting edge AI platforms.
MLOps - Implement and manage MLOps practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of models and in production environments.
Collaboration & Leadership – Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and product teams to align AI capabilities with business needs.
Mentorship & Coaching – Guide and support junior AI engineers, fostering a culture of learning and knowledge sharing


Qualifications


BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Hands-on experience in LLM-powered production applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, PyTorch).
Proven experience with AWS and cloud-based AI deployments.
Solid understanding of AI model fine-tuning, optimization, and evaluation.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and multi-agent AI architectures.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs
Familiarity with MLOps best practices for deploying and monitoring AI models in production.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Eagerness to learn and adapt
Strong communication skills in English, capable of explaining complex AI concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing.


If you’re excited about pushing the boundaries of AI and mentoring the next generation of engineers, we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:


💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).
📍 Beautiful office with a view of Lake Geneva, conveniently located next to the Prilly-Malley train station
🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.
🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.
🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.
🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.
🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.


Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Machine Learning, Data Science, and Software Development - Internship
Description:
Contexte et environnement

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

The Department of Modelling and Analysis for Trading Strategies at TotalEnergies Gas and Power leverages machine learning and algorithmic trading to deliver actionable insights to trading desks. Based in Geneva, the team operates in a dynamic environment influenced by evolving market trends, climate policies, and advancements in the energy sector. Focused on creating practical and lasting solutions, the team develops robust software products such as advanced Auto-ML libraries. With expertise in machine learning, data science, and software engineering, the team is committed to delivering impactful tools that drive innovation and efficiency.

This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a real-world setting, contributing to the company's goal of achieving Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Activités

Activities:


Assist in the development of advanced AutoML time-series forecasting libraries tailored for trading, energy management, and optimization. Contribute to innovation in data science and machine learning through both applied development and research, exploring state-of-the-art methods to enhance forecasting accuracy and model robustness. Participate in software engineering challenges, code reviews, testing, and integration processes to ensure high-quality, production-ready solutions



Possible subjects of the internship include:


Double Machine Learning for causal inference in energy markets — Conduct research on applying DML methods to estimate causal effects, improving decision-making and trading strategies through robust causal analysis.
Extension of AutoML capabilities for time-series forecasting — Develop and test new modules to expand existing ML libraries, improving scalability, robustness, and user experience for applications in energy trading, management, and optimization.
Evaluation metrics research for forecasting models — Investigate and define optimal KPIs for assessing time-series forecasting performance, focusing on practical relevance, interpretability, and measurable business impact.



Profil du candidat


Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field.
Strong interest in machine learning, data science, and software engineering.
A solid understanding of data science/machine learning principles and familiarity with software development, or strong software development skills with a working knowledge of data science and machine learning concepts.
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with ML libraries such as Scikit-learn, XGboost, TensorFlow, etc.
Eagerness to learn and innovate, with a proactive approach to problem-solving.



Fluency in English or French, with an advanced command of English required.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Sigma Suisse is seeking for it's client, a company in the trading sector, a Machine Learning Engineer :




Job Description :




Build and deploy machine learning systems addressing complex energy sector challenges

Partner with business teams to translate requirements into technical solutions

Implement AI capabilities (including LLMs) within existing infrastructure

Lead code quality initiatives and experimental framework design

Mentor colleagues in data science methodologies




Qualifications




Advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or quantitative field

3+ years hands-on experience building production ML systems

Expert-level Python programming with software engineering best practices

Proficiency in deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face)

Cloud computing experience (AWS) and containerization knowledge

Excellent analytical and stakeholder communication abilities




Background




Financial markets or commodity trading exposure

Dashboard development using visualization frameworks

Forecasting and econometric modeling expertise

Scalable system architecture experience

Workflow orchestration platforms knowledge

DevOps and automated deployment practices

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer




Essentials (please *don't apply* if you don't match all three):

You should have EU or Swiss nationality/C permit.
You should be top 5% both at your Bachelor and at your Master.
You should upload your full transcripts.




Role

You will work closely with our clients and project managers to design solutions, process data, train AI models, deploy models, and maintain them.
You will be involved in the full development process of AI products, to build the optimal solution for every situation.
You will collaborate and support our software engineers and infrastructure team to ensure smooth integration.
Your strong interpersonal skills will enable you to engage effectively with clients, both in-person and remotely.




Location

Lugano, min. 80% on site.

 

Required competence and attitudes

Strong programming skills (Python, SQL, …) and knowledge of ML libraries (e.g. TensorFlow, Pytorch, Scikit-learn, …).
In-depth knowledge of ML technologies, concepts and applications.
Expertise in data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Matplotlib, Power BI, ...).
Competences in deployment tools (Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD).
Familiarity with developing with Git (GitLab/Github/Bitbucket).
Experience with modern Python web frameworks such as FastAPI, Flask is a plus.
Expertise in system architecture, databases (e.g. PostgreSQL), cloud computing (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Work experience is a plus.

 

Education

Top 5% Master’s degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Informatics, Engineering, or equivalent.




Languages

English: Strong command.
Strong command of Italian or German; French is a plus.




We offer

Full-time permanent contract.
Fast career development, attractive compensation.
Stimulating scientific context and informal environment.
Training, tutoring, and close relationship with cutting-edge research teams.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

As our portfolio of work continues to grow, we are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our data science and machine learning team. The individual will work closely with the data and machine learning specialists, software engineers and commercial teams to deliver machine learning models and applications.

We work across the trading business, operations, and other support functions; so the individual will need to be comfortable working with a variety of stakeholders and technologies.

The Machine Learning Engineer at Vitol has visibility and impact across the full project workflow: from working with business stakeholders to help define the project, to data collation and processing, exploratory analysis, model selection and tuning, and implementation of production models.

The successful candidate will join a team of experienced, collaborative practitioners, who are (pragmatically) solving some of the most challenging and impactful problems the energy industry is facing; as well as pushing the boundaries around the ‘art of the possible’.

Core Responsibilities Include


Being an energetic and enthusiastic member of a team uniquely positioned to bring the power of data to bear on the inner workings of the energy industry
Leading design, development, and deployment of machine learning systems, bringing their technical knowledge and experience into the team, and using this to create real solutions to real problems
Collaborating with cross-functional technology teams to gather requirements and ensure the solutions align with business objectives
Helping integrate the team’s solutions (including generative AI) into existing systems and platforms to provide seamless user experiences and scale adoption
Actively participating in code reviews, experiment design and tooling decisions to help drive the team’s velocity and quality
Helping build data and machine learning expertise within the business through knowledge sharing


Qualifications


Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. Ph.D. is a plus
Fluency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code as well as a solid understanding of coding best practices
3-5+ years in industry developing and deploying machine learning models
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Transformers
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS) and containerization technologies (Docker)
Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to work independently and in a team
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Understanding of machine learning fundamentals, including deep learning, generative models, NLP techniques, etc.


Desired Experience


Experience in the energy or commodities trading industry, with knowledge of financial markets and trading concepts
Experience integrating machine learning systems into interactive dashboards (e.g. Dash, Streamlit) and present use cases of machine learning to non-technical colleagues
Time series modelling (both machine-learning and econometric approaches)
Application of a wide range of ML methodologies to real life applications
Enterprise software development (systems design, code review, version control, etc.)
Data orchestrators (Airflow, Dagster) and cloud-based ETL/ELT pipelines
Awareness of continuous integration and delivery concepts/technologies


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


A self-motivated individual who thrives on seeing the results of their work make an impact in the business
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Proven ability to be flexible, work hard, and a sense for the art of the possible
Methodical, organized and with an attention to detail - in general, in experimental design, and in code!
Willingness to share their knowledge and learn from others
An interest in learning about the commodities space
Resourceful, able to think creatively and adapt in a dynamic environment
Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of integrity
Desire to be a thought-partner in a fast-growing team, and make an impact at a business that sits at the heart of the world’s energy flows


What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package
Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
Strong management commitment to incorporating machine learning into the future of Vitol’s operations
Show more

  • Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
  • Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
  • A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
  • Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

This Data Science position is embedded within the Analytics Team, which plays a pivotal role in developing tools and analyses that drive the day-to-day operations of Vitol. The successful candidate will leverage data science and machine learning to revolutionize how Vitol tracks and anticipates commodity movements across the globe.

While regular collaboration with the central Data Science team is expected, this role is uniquely positioned within the team of developers and analysts focused on vessel and cargo flows. This setup fosters knowledge exchange, process improvements, and regular interaction with various business units that depend on these analyses.

The ideal candidate will have a hands-on approach, ready to dive deep into data, build models, create visualizations, and deliver actionable insights as needed. They will thrive in a fast-paced environment and be motivated by seeing their work have an immediate impact on Vitol’s operations.

Key Responsabilities :


Be an energetic and enthusiastic team member, uniquely positioned to harness the power of data to transform the inner workings of the commodities industry
Gain a deep understanding of Vitol’s core operations and develop creative solutions using data, automation, analytics, models, and optimization to enhance these operations
Explore new datasets and external vendor predictions/algorithms, extract meaningful insights, and present results through visualizations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Work closely with domain experts to design and implement machine learning solutions that are both understandable and usable by non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate with the central Data Science team and IT department to leverage existing tools and capabilities to deliver value to the business


Qualifications


Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent experience
Strong foundation in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning or equivalent experience
Extensive experience in exploring and extracting insights from heterogeneous multi-dimensional datasets is essential
Proficiency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code in a collaborative development environment
Experience in visualizing complex data for diverse audiences using tools such as D3.js, Bokeh, Plotly or similar frameworks
5-7 years of industry experience as a data scientist on real-world datasets, is preferred
C# development experience is a plus
French language skills are an advantage but not required


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


Proven experience in working within an Agile Scrum development model
Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team
Proactive and user-focused approach, embodying a "make it work" mentality, with a genuine interest in both the functional and technical aspects of challenges encountered
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration across diverse teams
Fluent in English, with full proficiency in business communication, both verbal and written
Passionate about leveraging data science and machine learning to innovate and disrupt traditionally human-centric industries
Skilled in deriving, abstracting, and translating value from complex models into actionable insights within a commercial context
Resourceful, creative, and adaptable, thriving in fast-paced, results-driven environments


What We Offer


Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Our Geneva office is located very centrally, 5 minutes from the main train station and 1 minute from the lake. The office has a rooftop lunch area, with views over the lake and Alps.
We organize regular activities to enable our people to meet colleagues from other teams in an informal setting, and to celebrate special achievements

Title: Head of AI & Data Science
Description:
Company Overview

Imagine leveraging your expertise in AI and data science to directly improve the lives of millions of people living with hypertension. Hilo by Aktiia, is revolutionizing how cardiovascular health is monitored and managed. They've developed and commercialized the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor, empowering both patients and physicians with unprecedented insights into blood pressure patterns. Backed by over $100M in funding from top-tier investors across Europe and the US, Hilo is an early-stage, fast-growing startup rooted in over 20 years of research at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Their CE-certified, Class IIa medical device is already available in over 10 countries worldwide—and they're just getting started.

As Aktiia enters a new growth phase, we're looking for a capable and visionary "Head of AI & Data Science" to scale their capabilities and lead a team that sits at the heart of the product innovation.

HEAD OF AI & DATA SCIENCE

Role & Responsibilities


Team & Project Leadership


Own planning, prioritization, and execution of AI & Data Science initiatives. Align roadmaps with product requirements and drive timely delivery with your team.


Cross-functional Collaboration


Act as the operational bridge between AI, Product, Marketing, Customer Support teams and the CTO. Solve blockers and ensure smooth collaboration.


People Development


Lead and grow a diverse team through coaching, recruitment, performance reviews, and day-to-day guidance - with a balance of empathy and results-orientation.


External Engagement


Interface with medical professionals, customers, and strategic partners. Incorporate feedback and deliver concepts, documentation, and visual materials.


Process Optimization


Define and implement workflows and structures that support scalable, efficient team operations.

Your profile


Academic Background


PhD in Informatics, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, Data Science, Signal Processing or a related field.


Technical Expertise


5+ years of hands-on engineering experience in data science and ML/AI. Strong Python skills and familiarity with ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn). Solid understanding of CNNs, RNNs and time series analysis. Medtech and signal processing knowledge (PPG, ECG) are a plus.


Leadership Experience


Several years experience of people management, ideally with responsibility for 10+ team members. Experience in fast-paced environments and team transformation.


Industry Fit


Background in regulated industries (e.g. medtech, pharma, fintech, aerospace). Experience in startups or mid-sized companies preferred.


Language Skills


English at highly proficient level is a must. French, German or Italian are advantageous.


Personality


Energetic, intellectually curious, hands-on and collaborative. A natural team leader who inspires others and leads with clarity and positivity.

Do you want to build something that changes lives while advancing science and technology? Then we're excited to meet you!
Show more

Act as the operational bridge between AI, Product, Marketing, Customer Support teams and the CTO. Solve blockers and ensure smooth collaboration.

  • People Development

Lead and grow a diverse team through coaching, recruitment, performance reviews, and day-to-day guidance - with a balance of empathy and results-orientation.

  • External Engagement

Interface with medical professionals, customers, and strategic partners. Incorporate feedback and deliver concepts, documentation, and visual materials.

  • Process Optimization

Define and implement workflows and structures that support scalable, efficient team operations.

Your profile

  • Academic Background

PhD in Informatics, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, Data Science, Signal Processing or a related field.

  • Technical Expertise

5+ years of hands-on engineering experience in data science and ML/AI. Strong Python skills and familiarity with ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn). Solid understanding of CNNs, RNNs and time series analysis. Medtech and signal processing knowledge (PPG, ECG) are a plus.

  • Leadership Experience

Several years experience of people management, ideally with responsibility for 10+ team members. Experience in fast-paced environments and team transformation.

  • Industry Fit

Background in regulated industries (e.g. medtech, pharma, fintech, aerospace). Experience in startups or mid-sized companies preferred.

  • Language Skills

English at highly proficient level is a must. French, German or Italian are advantageous.

  • Personality

Energetic, intellectually curious, hands-on and collaborative. A natural team leader who inspires others and leads with clarity and positivity.

Do you want to build something that changes lives while advancing science and technology? Then we're excited to meet you!

Title: Head of AI & Data Science
Description:
Company Overview

Imagine leveraging your expertise in AI and data science to directly improve the lives of millions of people living with hypertension. Hilo by Aktiia, is revolutionizing how cardiovascular health is monitored and managed. They've developed and commercialized the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor, empowering both patients and physicians with unprecedented insights into blood pressure patterns. Backed by over $100M in funding from top-tier investors across Europe and the US, Hilo is an early-stage, fast-growing startup rooted in over 20 years of research at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Their CE-certified, Class IIa medical device is already available in over 10 countries worldwide—and they're just getting started.

As Aktiia enters a new growth phase, we're looking for a capable and visionary "Head of AI & Data Science" to scale their capabilities and lead a team that sits at the heart of the product innovation.

HEAD OF AI & DATA SCIENCE

Role & Responsibilities


Team & Project Leadership


Own planning, prioritization, and execution of AI & Data Science initiatives. Align roadmaps with product requirements and drive timely delivery with your team.


Cross-functional Collaboration


Act as the operational bridge between AI, Product, Marketing, Customer Support teams and the CTO. Solve blockers and ensure smooth collaboration.


People Development


Lead and grow a diverse team through coaching, recruitment, performance reviews, and day-to-day guidance - with a balance of empathy and results-orientation.


External Engagement


Interface with medical professionals, customers, and strategic partners. Incorporate feedback and deliver concepts, documentation, and visual materials.


Process Optimization


Define and implement workflows and structures that support scalable, efficient team operations.

Your profile


Academic Background


PhD in Informatics, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, Data Science, Signal Processing or a related field.


Technical Expertise


5+ years of hands-on engineering experience in data science and ML/AI. Strong Python skills and familiarity with ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn). Solid understanding of CNNs, RNNs and time series analysis. Medtech and signal processing knowledge (PPG, ECG) are a plus.


Leadership Experience


Several years experience of people management, ideally with responsibility for 10+ team members. Experience in fast-paced environments and team transformation.


Industry Fit


Background in regulated industries (e.g. medtech, pharma, fintech, aerospace). Experience in startups or mid-sized companies preferred.


Language Skills


English at highly proficient level is a must. French, German or Italian are advantageous.


Personality


Energetic, intellectually curious, hands-on and collaborative. A natural team leader who inspires others and leads with clarity and positivity.

Do you want to build something that changes lives while advancing science and technology? Then we're excited to meet you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Spacewise is an innovative B2B SaaS proptech company headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, with a rapidly expanding presence. Spacewise is revolutionizing the way commercial real estate landlords market, manage, and monetize their portfolios and spaces online to supercharge the value of their consumer facing properties. Spacewise also operates the premier online marketplace for short-term, pop-up, and promotional spaces.




For landlords, we provide user-friendly software tools to digitize property and space inventory for seamless space marketing and management. Our platform is trusted by major organizations such as Regency Centers and Centennial in North America; and Migros, Coop, SBB, Swiss Post, and Wincasa in Europe, just to name a few. Furthermore, we enable lead generation and booking activities for many of the world’s most renowned brands. Tenants of all sizes use our platform to effortlessly search, evaluate, and book the perfect location for their marketing activations, events, pop-ups, and promotions.




Are you passionate about digital transformation and helping to shape the future of one of the biggest asset classes in the world? Do you like working in an innovative, fast-paced environment? If so, the role as Data Scientist at Spacewise could be the perfect opportunity for you.


Tasks



Develop predictive models and algorithms that analyze various data inputs, including location intelligence, foot traffic, and economic trends, to improve decision-making processes.


Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, and business) to integrate machine learning models and data insights into the product ecosystem.


Identify, collect, and analyze relevant data sources to deliver insights that enhance property pricing strategies, space utilization, and tenant matching.


Create and refine forecasting models to predict future trends and outcomes, such as foot traffic patterns, sales potential, and space demand.


Perform exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling to understand key business drivers and deliver actionable recommendations.


Build and maintain scalable data pipelines to enable real-time analytics and reporting.


Communicate complex analytical results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, contributing to the strategic direction of the company.



Requirements



Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.


Proven experience in building machine learning models and algorithms, preferably within the real estate, retail, or spatial analytics domains.Strong proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Python, R, SQL, Pandas, Matplotlib).


Experience working with large datasets and applying statistical techniques such as regression, clustering, and time-series analysis.Familiarity with location-based analytics and spatial data, including the use of geospatial data for forecasting and analysis.


Experience developing pricing algorithms or revenue management systems is a strong plus.Ability to communicate complex concepts clearly to both technical and business teams.


Familiarity with cloud-based platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure for data storage and analysis.


Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.





Preferred Qualifications:





Experience with recommendation systems or personalization algorithms.


Knowledge of optimization techniques for pricing and inventory management.


Familiarity with foot traffic data, sales potential forecasting, and revenue optimization strategies in commercial spaces.



Benefits



Competitive salary and benefits package.


Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative environment at the intersection of real estate and technology.


Remote-friendly workplace with flexible working hours.


Growth opportunities in a rapidly scaling company.





Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and why you're a good fit for this role.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Building the bank of tomorrow takes more than skills.

It means combining our differences to imagine, discuss, code, develop, test, learn… and celebrate every step together. Share our vibes? Join Swissquote to unleash your potential.

We are the Swiss Leader in Online Banking and we provide trading, investing and banking services to +500’000 clients, through our performant and secured digital platforms.

Our +1000 employees work in a flexible way, without dress code and in multicultural teams.

By having a huge impact on the industry, they are growing their skills portfolio and boosting their career in a fast-pace environment

We are all in at Swissquote. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome candidates from all backgrounds, experiences and perspectives to join our team and contribute to our shared success.

Are you all in? Don’t be shy, apply!

Job Description

Swissquote is looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our rapidly expanding Quantitative Research & Solutions department. This is an exciting opportunity for recent graduates with relevant internship experience in data science, machine learning or related fields, who are eager to launch their career in a fast-paced and innovative environment.

Responsibilities


Develop machine learning models.
Design and develop data pipelines.
Perform statistical data analysis.
Develop and experiment with generative AI models, including leveraging proprietary APIs and fine-tuning pre-trained models for custom applications.
Rapidly prototype models and conduct experiments to validate hypotheses and improve model performance.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Communicate complex findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, supporting data-driven decision-making.


Qualifications


Educational Background: Master’s degree in Data Science, Physics, Mathematics, Computer science or a related quantitative field.
Experience: One or more relevant internships in data science, machine learning, or AI-related fields.


Skills

Technical Skills:


Solid programming skills in Python, including experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy).
Hands-on experience developing machine learning models, either in academic projects or through internships, using libraries such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Familiar with version control tools
Good understanding of statistical analysis techniques, including hypothesis testing, anomaly detection, and data modeling.
Proficient in creating data visualizations using tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, or dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Basic understanding of LLM architectures (e.g., Transformer-based models) and experience experimenting with LLM APIs (such as OpenAI or Hugging Face) is a strong plus.


Soft Skills


Eagerness to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment.
Good communication skills and team spirit.
Analytical and problem-solving mindset.
Ability to take initiative and manage time effectively.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.




We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.




Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




We use a modern stack of:





PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS


Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks


As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.




Particularly, you will get to:





Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.


Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.


All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.


Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.


Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.





In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Requirements


Ideally, you have:





MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.


Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.


Experience with building and shipping software solutions.


Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits


We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




Interested? Contact us!




We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Swarovski, where innovation meets inspiration, our people desire to explore, experience and create. As a Data Scientist you will get a chance to work in a rewarding role within a diverse team that is pushing boundaries. Be part of a truly iconic global brand, learn and grow with us. We’re bold and inventive, revealing astonishing things like no one else can. A world of wonder awaits you.

About The Job

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


Designing and developing quantitative and generative AI assets by translating business problems and requirements into actionable insights
Partnering with other Business Functions to align with market state-of-the-art solutions and identify Advanced Analytics opportunities to be embedded the existing processes
Developing data science products ensuring business improvements are impactful and aligned to the company objectives and strategy, including appropriate and structured documentation of the methodology and data used
Leverage the Data Lake information and cloud infrastructure as well as the current technology landscape to design the solutions
Selecting features, building and optimizing models using Machine Learning and other Advanced Analytics techniques
Coordinating with the Innovation reference people to identify suitable processes for AI agents, analyze them and develop AI Agents use cases
Presenting results and insights to business and driving the conversation about innovation directions in the Advanced Analytics space


About You

We are looking for a unique and amazing talent, who brings along the following:


University degree/ Education, preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or similar
Minimum 3 years of professional experience in a similar role within an international setting
Proficiency in Python and/or R, modelling & real-time analytics, database languages (e.g., SQL), big data frameworks, and Cloud platforms (e.g. Google Cloud Platform, Azure, AWS)
Deep understanding of Generative AI models their implementation in business settings
Previous experience with AI Agents (e.g. GCP Agent builder) is a plus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Team orientation and ability to work and interface effectively with all levels of the organization
Excellent English proficiency, presentation and communication skills


What We Offer

You can expect a range of benefits, including:


Swarovski products discounts
Full coverage of accident insurance
Attractive pension fund conditions
Subsidized public transportation or free parking
Employee canteen with buffet


Masters of Light Since 1895

Swarovski creates beautiful crystal-based products of impeccable quality and craftsmanship that bring joy and celebrate individuality.

Founded in 1895 in Austria, the company designs, manufactures and sells the world's finest crystal, gemstones, Swarovski Created Diamonds and zirconia, jewelry, and accessories, as well as crystal objects and home accessories. Swarovski Crystal Business has a global reach with approximately 2,400 stores and 6,700 points of sales in around 140 countries and employs more than 18,000 people. Together with its sister companies Swarovski Optik (optical devices) and Tyrolit (abrasives), Swarovski Crystal Business forms the Swarovski Group. A responsible relationship with people and the planet is part of Swarovski’s heritage. Today this legacy is rooted in sustainability measures across the value chain, with an emphasis on circular innovation, championing diversity, inclusion and self-expression, and in the philanthropic work of the Swarovski Foundation, which supports charitable organizations bringing positive environmental and social impact.

Swarovski is an equal opportunity employer. We give our people the guts to celebrate individuality and pride ourselves on creating a workplace where people feel involved, respected, valued, connected, and heard. A place where anyone/everyone belongs. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under the law of the countries we operate in.

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

As a Data Scientist at QuantumBlack, you will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

In this role, you will be responsible for working on complex and extremely varied data sets from some of the world’s largest organizations to solve real-world problems. You will develop high-quality data science products and solutions for clients as well as assets for our internal data teams, focusing on modeling and working alongside the Data Engineering team. Additionally, you will present findings, recommendations, and provide consultation to stakeholders, both internal and clients.

Throughout your tenure, you will learn to work across various industries and sectors, gaining insights into diverse business challenges and applications of data science. You will build large-scale data and analytics solutions, handling complex problems and advanced client situations. You will also learn best practices in data and analytics development, including framework, responsibility model, high-quality code, data security, sustainability, and scalability. Working in collaborative teams with diverse skill sets, you will foster effective teamwork and learn from colleagues in a multicultural and creative environment. Staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science tools, techniques, and technologies, as well as participating in first-class learning programs, will be a key part of your development. You will also develop strong client-facing skills, including effective communication, problem-solving, and presentation abilities.

You will work with other data scientists, data/ML engineers, designers, project managers, and business subject matter experts on interdisciplinary projects across various industry sectors to enable business ambitions with data and analytics.

In terms of who you are, you are a highly collaborative individual capable of setting aside your own agenda to listen to and learn from colleagues. You challenge thoughtfully and prioritize impact. You constantly seek ways to improve and work collaboratively with others. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning, and improving to move forward quickly.

Our tech stack is diverse. While we advocate for using the right tools for the right task, we also take into account the client’s current landscape and preferences. Often, we use Python, PySpark, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Databricks, SQL, Docker, and Kubernetes. We also leverage our own proprietary tools such as Kedro, CausalNex, and MLRun. We work on a regular basis with cloud service providers such as AWS, GCP, and Azure.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in (business) math, statistics, machine learning, data science, physics, computer science or engineering required
Master's degree or PhD level in the field of data science, computer science, business informatics or equivalent is a plus
Up to 2 years of professional hands-on experience in applying advanced data science methods and implementing technical data solutions (e.g. develop machine learning models), in order to solve business problems
A strong grasp of various analytics landscape, including business intelligence, machine learning, AI, and generative AI, and how to apply them effectively in different scenarios
Proficiency in Python, SQL (focus on data & analytics applications)
Professional experience in cloud-based analytical tools from market-leading providers such as AWS, MS Azure, Google Cloud
Proficient communication skills in German and English
Effective communication and presentation skills, particularly the ability to explain complex analytical concepts in a comprehensible manner adapted to different groups of non-technical audiences e.g. business managers, heads of products, sales & marketing leads
Practical experience in generative AI application development
Proven record of advisory works
Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
Show more

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Role Context

As part of our mission to develop innovative solutions for optimizing procurement and supply chain operations, we are seeking an AI Engineer with a strong background in procurement.

The successful candidate will design, develop, and deploy AI solutions to streamline purchasing processes, improve supplier management, and deliver measurable financial gains.




Key Responsibilities

Business analysis & requirements gathering

Understand existing procurement processes (strategic, tactical, and operational)
Identify optimization opportunities through data and AI applications
Collaborate with procurement teams to define and prioritize use cases

AI solution design & development

Build machine learning / deep learning models for:
Price and market trend forecasting
Supplier evaluation and segmentation
Tender and negotiation optimization
Anomaly detection (fraud, billing errors)
Implement multi-criteria optimization algorithms for supply management

Data engineering & procurement data processing

Gather, clean, and enrich internal and external data (ERP, procurement systems, supplier databases, market intelligence)
Set up reliable, scalable data pipelines

Industrialization & integration

Deploy AI models within existing procurement tools (ERP, e-procurement, BI platforms)
Ensure model performance, robustness, and maintenance

Technology watch & continuous improvement

Keep track of AI innovations applied to procurement and supply chain
Suggest improvements based on user feedback and evolving needs




Candidate Profile

Education

Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or Engineering
Additional certification in procurement/supply chain is a plus (e.g., CIPS, MAI, ISLI)

Experience

3–5 years’ experience in AI / data science roles
Proven track record in procurement or on AI projects applied to procurement

Technical skills

Programming: Python & R
Knowledge of mathematical optimization, and time series forecasting

Business skills

Strong understanding of procurement processes (direct, indirect, sourcing, tendering)
Familiarity with key KPIs (TCO, procurement ROI, supplier performance)
Awareness of contractual and regulatory considerations

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
THIS JOB IS NOT A REMOTE JOB. WORK ONSITE IS OBLIGATORY.




Snapbau is a digital purchasing management platform used by more than 320 construction companies in Switzerland, including major players such as Orllati, CPSA, Scrasa and ARSA. Our solution automates and optimises the management of calls for tender and purchasing, enabling companies to save time, reduce errors and centralise collaboration with suppliers.




You will be part of the team responsible for designing and building the AI layer of Snapbau’s digital operating system for procurement and coordination in the construction sector.


Tasks


AI System Design & Development





Develop machine learning and AI models to automate and optimize construction procurement workflows (e.g. price prediction, document classification, lead scoring, supplier matching).


Build generative AI features to assist with document generation, meeting summaries, and structured communication.


Create and maintain pipelines for training, testing, and deploying ML models.


Develop lightweight APIs or services to integrate AI modules into the Snapbau platform.





Data Engineering & Management





Work closely with backend developers to structure, clean, and extract usable data from various sources (e.g. supplier databases, project histories, tender documents).


Apply construction-specific taxonomies (e.g. eBKP-H, CRB) to enable structured, domain-relevant decision-making.


Improve model performance through effective feature engineering based on our domain data.





Product Integration





Collaborate with product managers and frontend developers to design and implement AI-powered tools for end users.


Ensure AI components are integrated into Snapbau’s user experience in a fast, reliable, and intuitive way.


Monitor model performance post-deployment and adjust based on feedback and new data.





Strategy & Innovation





Contribute to Snapbau’s long-term AI architecture and roadmap.


Stay updated on advancements in applied AI (LLMs, computer vision, agent workflows, etc.) and evaluate their relevance for construction tech.


Help define AI-related hiring, tooling, and infrastructure needs as the team scales.



Requirements



Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models (especially NLP, classification, recommendation, or price prediction).


Strong programming skills in Python; familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, FastAPI.


Experience building and maintaining ML pipelines.


Familiarity with REST APIs and integrating ML models into production environments.


Solid understanding of data wrangling and structuring from messy or unstructured sources.


Knowledge of or willingness to learn domain-specific standards such as eBKP-H or CRB is a strong plus.


Experience working in fast-paced, cross-functional product teams.


Ability to work autonomously while contributing to a strategic, long-term vision.





Join Snapbau if you want to shape how AI transforms the future of construction procurement. This role offers high impact, deep technical ownership, and a direct path into one of the most overlooked but critical sectors of the real economy.

Show more
